12111111.content:
Suit ruptured. Air venting. Lungs burning. Alchera wheeled overhead as Commander Shepard tumbled through silent space. The stars began to go dim as his brain starved for oxygen. He was dead by the time he hit the atmosphere.

-----

When he woke, though a little suprised to find himself alive, he knew something was very wrong. He could barely open his eyes; they refused to focus on the stark white roof overhead. He was laid out; though he could barely feel the table beneath him. Arms were too weak to lift their own weight; legs... he couldn't feel his legs at all.

He tried to take a breath; it gurgled in his burnt lungs like a death rattle.

"My God, Miranda, I think he's waking up," a man said.

"Damnit, Wilson. He's not ready yet! Give him the sedative." A woman entered his vision. She stared down at him with sympathy. "Shepard, don't try to move. Just try to stay calm."

"Not ready yet?" the man scoffed. "There's no way we can repair this sort of damage. Heart-rate's still climbing. Stat's are pushing into the red zone. It's not working!"

"Another sedative! Now!"

With an almighty effort, Shepard was finally able to will movement into his body. He caught sight of the burnt, broken, dismembered body that was now his, before the sedative flowed through him, sending him to blissful oblivion. The woman's face - beautiful, chiselled, perfect - was the last thing he saw.

----

"Wake up, Commander!" Shepard suddenly heard a man's voice calling his name. "Shepard, get your ass out of this bed now, this place is under attack!"
Shaking. But body responding. He felt whole again. Had it all been a dream?
"Damnit! Get moving, now!". Distant gunfire heard through several bulkheads.
"There's a pistol and armor in the locker at the farside of the room. Move it!"

Instantly, Shepard sprinted over to the locker, opened it...
And got the shock of his life!
In the small mirror on the locker's door, he saw not the reflection he was used to. No, instead staring back at him was the woman he had seen when he woke before.

His Alliance special forces training took over and he grabbed the white armor with orange stripes from the locker - only to realize it was a woman's model.
And suddenly a horrifying realization ran through his mind.

"What..." Shepard brought out puzzled, just to realize it was not his voice either.

Quickly he looked down and saw two globes of flesh sitting on his, or rather her, chest.
"No time to explain, suit up. Now!" Shepard heard the man's voice barking an order at him.

And so he, or rather she, did. Luckily, men and women's battle armor were designed the same, so Shepard had no trouble getting it on, except from the unused feeling of the weights on her chest getting pressed into the armor's front cups.

A pistol lay beneath the armor. She grabbed it. After all the confusion it seemed reassuring to hold. Only...
"This pistol misses something!" she said as she found out that part of it was gone.
"Crap... You need to find and insert a thermal clip into it. But not now, get into cover, those canisters in front of the door are going to explode!".

A canister near the door was venting gas. Shepard dived behind an upturned table just as it exploded. The door slid open. Vaulting over the table, Shepard sprinted through the smoke and out the door. A thermal clip lay discarded on the floor. Slamming it into the pistol, she felt it come alive again.
12111111.title: Miranda Effect 2

121111111.content:
"Someone's hacking security trying to get you killed! Damned, incoming!" Jacob's voice jelled in Shepard's ear as she already saw a mech advancing down on some stairs in front of her!
Quickly, she dispatched it with her pistol.

"That was not the last one, look out!" Jacob continued as she was entering the adjacent room, a laboratory. This time, a firefight with a bunch of mechs ensued which ended victorious for her.
But the heads of exploding mechs was not the only thing she saw. Cerberus! she thought as she saw the orange insignia on the walls.

Next, Shepard ran through a hallway until she came into a section with an elevator. "More incoming! There's a grenade launcher, quick!".
Quickly she grabbed it and got rid of the incoming foes.

Just then she came by a small office with a terminal on the desk. Behind it, all sorts of medical information was displayed on the wall screens. Curiously she activated it. A vidlog started playing.
"Progress is slow, subject shows little signs of recovery. Major organs are functional, and there are signs of rudimentary neurological activity. In an effort to accelerate the process, we've moved from simple organic reconstruction of the subject to bio-synthetic fusion. Initial results show promise, though we're not quite sure if it will be sufficient." the image of the attractive brunette woman with the Australian accent told.
Subject... What were they doing here?

Just then Jacob's voice shout in her ear pierce. "Shepard, quick! Move your ass over here, I can't hold them off much longer!"
Speedily she sprinted through another hallway, seeing another YMIR mech killing a scientist through a window.
Finally she ran up some stairs, opened the doors and ended in a section of the research base with a few bridges in it.
There, Jacob Taylor was fighting against a pack of mechs!

1211111211.content:
Suit ruptured. Air venting. Lungs burning. Alchera wheeled overhead as Commander Shepard tumbled through silent space. The stars began to go dim as his brain starved for oxygen. He was dead by the time he hit the atmosphere.

-----

Eight months later

"Dammit Wilson, what are you saying!? You said it was possible to bring him back" Miranda shouted to the medical officer.

"I said it could be possible to bring him back, but now we can't. His cells and DNA are more damaged than we thought. Exposure to space, burning up in the atmosphere, and freezing on Alchera was too much for his armor to preserve" Wilson calmly explained.

Miranda allowed a rare face of defeat. She stared through into the room the hunk of meat that was Commander Shepard sat. She sighed in disspointment. "So this has all been a waste of time" Miranda said softly.

"Not quite" said Wilson with a slightly terrified look.

Miranda lit up in a biotic flare. "What?" was all she said.

"You see Shepard's body was damaged beyond repair, but his brain was kept intact by the ice. We could probably jump start if we put it in a new host" Wilson said nerviously.

Miranda calmed down and began to take this in. "So we could clone Shepard's body and put the old brain in the new body" She asked

Wilson shook his head. "That's the problem. The DNA we recovered has too many gaps for a successful cloning, and filling them in ourselves could be catastrophic" He continued.

"Surely the alliance or the council has samples in their records" Miranda asked.

"We can't get to those either. Thanks to his N7 and spectre status, there virtually untouchable. The Illusive man tried pulling all sorts of strings yet he couldn't get them. He even sent Kai Leng and he came up short" Wilson explained almost shaking now.

Miranda took all of this in. "What are you keeping from me" Miranda said, having picked up on Wilson's shaking.

"Well, obviously we need to get a host body for Shepard, but even then there's a problem with that. He apperantly had an extremely rare disorder, the nerves in brain use a higher electrical current than most humans do. If we don't get the currents right, it would destroy the brain. As such we can't just find anyone to stick his brain into" Wilson said, still nervious.

"Then we find people with the same disorder, and select the best match" Miranda said confidently.

"It would be next to impossible, 99% of people with this disorder go through their lives without realizing they have it. It could be a year until we find a handfull of subjects" Wilson continued.

"Then what do you suggest we do" Miranda said now annoyed.

"Well, here's the thing. We have a perfect match for Shepard's brain, we just have rebuild the body based on the DNA we have" Wilson said.

"Bloody hell, then why are we having this conversation" Miranda said.

"The problem is the body it's self, do you remember one of Shepard's squadmates gunnery chief Ashley Williams" Wilson said now trembling.

"If I recall she died on Vermire..........no, you can't be serious" Miranda said now with full realization.

"It's literally all we got or else we lose Shepard forever" Wilson said.

Miranda looked back at the carcass watching two techies remove Shepard's brain from his former body. "If it's all we got, then make it so" Miranda finally said.

Wilson stared in shock at miranda for a good 10 seconds before leaving to make the arrangements. He knew he was stupid to mention Ashley, but it would be even stupider to question Miranda's judgement.

-----------

A year and a half later

Shepard woke for the first time in two years. He was disorientated, but more importantly confused as hell to his surroundings. "Where am I, some med bay in a base" He thought. He tried mustering the strength to get up, but couldn't a first. "Shit, the crew" He thought. It was coming back to him now, Saren, Vermire, Soverign, Alchera. That was enough to get him out of bed. He sat back up, when he realized he had longer hair now. He reached back pulled some of it forward. It was silky, black, and reached just past his shoulders. "I just got a cut before I left the citadel, I must have been out awhile" He thought, before he noticed his arms. While ceritanly muscular, they were much more slender and danity than before. "What the" he tried to say before covering his mouth. "This voice....isn't my voice" Shepard thought. Shepard stood up, until feeling his balance was off. He looked down and saw two pert orbs of flesh resting on his (now her) chest. "What did they do to me"She said with awe and anger. BEfore She could do anything though, an explosion rocked her off the bed. She got back up, and saw through the window. She was so enamored by herself that, she was oblivious to the battle happening outside.

"Shepard, can you hear me" A woman's voice said through the intercom.

"What did you do to me" Shepard yelled in her new voice.

"Later" The voice yelled back "First we need to get you out of there, grab the armor and pistol from the locker"

With no idea what was happening, Shepard decided to listen to the voice and ask questions later. She went into the locker and pulled out the armor. It was standard N7 except it was for a woman's. She looked down again at the globes of flesh again trying to work out what happened. Another explosion rocked the room.

"Shepard, get your armor on, we'll explain everything later" The voice yelled again.

With shit getting real, she finally sliped into her armor. It was virtually identical to her old armor, with the one exception the additional space for her new breasts. Then she grabbed the pistol. It was a crappy M-3 Predator, but it had to do.

"This doesn't have a clip" Shepard yelled.

"You'll need to......SHIT, take cover Shepard!" The voice yelled. Shepard ducked behind a canister just in time for the door to explode. Escaping through it, she picked up a some thermal clips of a fallen mech.

"New model" She thought.

"Shepard, we're........losin........you....go through base....................find you" The voice said before cutting out.

"Well i'm on my own" Shepard thought. "Maybe I can find some answers"

What does she find first?
1211111211.title: Rebirth

12111112111.content:
Shepard continued down the hall moving at a brisk pace. She continued taking out mechs while moving through the base. By this point she had realized two things: She was back from the dead and a woman now. She was able to recall falling into space after the normandy was destroyed, before blacking out. This was just obvious. The second she couldn't figure out why. "Why couldn't just rebuild my body, was I that far gone" She shuddered at the thought. Nothing of her new body seemed out of place for a typical female marine (well other actually being one), except the voice. "Why have I heard this voice before" She thought. She definitely knew it was from someone from her past. She couldn't pinpoint it, but for some reason it brought back memories from vermire. Where she had to sacrifice Ashley to destroy the cloning facility. She shuddered again at the thought.

Two more mechs came from around the corner. After dispatching them a door opened on the wall. It was an office area with some logs still running on the computers. "Some answers maybe" Shepard thought. Activating one revealed a video log. It was a attractive brunette with an australian accent speaking: "Progress is slow, but the subject shows good signs of recovery. Major organs are functional and the target nurological current has been achieved. In an effort to accelerate the process, we've moved from simple organic reconstruction of the subject to bio-synthetic fusion for the donor body. The brain remains safely in cryo storage. Initial tests show promise, though we won't know if the brain can be re-activated until we begin the transplant."

"A brain transplant? It does explain the body, but a female one" Shepard thought. She then activated another console. This time a bald man spoke: "The cost of this project is astronomical. 4 billion credits so far, but no one seems to care. At any rate, progress on the Lazarus project is continuing as planned. Miranda thinks the Shepard will adjust to the new body, but i'm not so sure. Being a different gender is harsh enough, but being someone from such an important life event. We have no idea what tramautic effects this could have. Yet Miranda being the ice queen she is, continues to press on. She better pray she's right." Shepard tried to take this all in. Being female was one thing, but a person from her past. "Well then who"She thought.

Then she saw it. A mirror on one of the desks. Looking into it she saw someone she thought she would never see again "Ashley" Shepard said aloud. Yet turning around revealed nothing. "What the" Shepard thought. She looked back at the mirror and saw Ashley again. She was still standing there, copying the same movements you were making. "No it can't be" She thought, trying to convince herself. Then it hit her: "My voice...." That's why her voice was so familiar to her. It was Ashley's. "I'm Ash" Shepard thought again. She realized now why the voice was so familiar. It all made perfect sense now. She was now a perfect copy of Ashley. "But I saw her die on vermire" Shepard thought to herself. Shepard eventually came to the conclusion that the real Ashley was dead, and she was just a copy. But that still left the question of why?

Shepard stared at her new face in the mirror for a good 5 minutes, before another explosion rocked the room. "Okay get off the base first, then figure out who the hell did this to me" She concluded. After fighting through more mechs in hallways, Eventually Shepard came upon an open area with a bridge going through the room. In the middle a early 30's black man was fighting mechs on another bridge. It was clear he had been doing this for a while. "Allright he better know what the hell is going on" Shepard thought. Quickly, Shepard dispatched two mechs with head shots before diving next to the man under the railing. "At least Ash kept in shape"Shepard thought. The man turned and his eyes bulged out his skull in an instant.

"Shepard, you're awake! I thought you were a work in progress" The man asked.

"What the hell is going on. I need answers" Shepard yelled.

"Can't it wait" The man asked.

"NOW" Shepard screamed, sounding too much like an annoyed Ashley for her confort.

"Fine, here's the basics. My name is Jacob Taylor, Ex- alliance, you were listed as KIA after the Normandy was destroyed two years ago. This base was built for one porpose. To do everything scientificly possible to bring you back" Jacob said.

"Who did all this" Shepard asked in tamdem.

"An orginization that represents human intrests. I can't say anymore for now" Jacob continued.

"Allright you wanted to bring me back. But why Ashley" Shepard continued. More mechs arrived and returned heavy fire.

"Look, lets take out these mechs, then you can play 20 questions with me" Jacob told her

"Fine" Shepard agreed.

They took out the remaining mechs with ease, with help from Jacob's biotics, until they were ordered to retreat.

"That's the last of them. Ok, now you can ask me all the questions you want" Jacob said more relaxed.

"So you were bringing me back, fine, but how the hell did I end up looking like her" Shepard said angerly.

"Yeah, look I don't know the specifics, but this is the basic run down. After your death the council and the alliance just wanted everything with the reapers gone. Records were classified, witnesses silenced, evidence went missing. The battle of the citadel was like it never happened. We knew we needed a leader someone, who had been in the trenches and had experience fighting the reapers. The Lazarus project had the sole objective of bringing you back" Jacob explained.

"So how does this involve me getting the body of a former crew mate, a dead one at that" Shepard inquired.

"Eight months after we found you, we hit a snag. We failed to reconstuct your body based on the DNA we recovered and we couldn't access your old blood samples. We needed to do a brain transplant instead. But you also have a rare disorder that causes donor choices to be extermely limited for your brain. Finding a donor would normally be be next to impossible, but we had a combat ready donor DNA, that only had to be reconstucted. But as you can see it was gunnery chief Ashley Williams" Jacob explained reluctantly.

"Just the one person who was the most tramautic event in my recent memory" Shepard said still very angry.

"It was a narrow vote to go ahead with the plan, and for the record I voted aganist it. But we can't deny that it worked" Jacob retorted. Shepard tired to argue it, but Jacob had a point. She was alive, although much differently than when he had died. That still left one question.

"So what does Cerberus want with me" Shepard asked raising an eyebrow. For the second time Jacob was shocked.

"How do you know that" Jacob asked in bewilderment.

"I found some science logs, its how I figured out what happened to me. Also it doesn't help your logo is on all your shit" Shepard explained.

"We really got to fix that, however, there's a problem regarding humanity. Something so huge, it was worth the cost of bringing you back. My boss can fill you in but right now, Cerberus are the only ones doing anything about it" Jacob said. Shepard processed all of this while the woman from earlier came back on the mic.

"Jacob I have a shuttle ready, did you find Shepard" The voice asked.

"Yeah, saved my life actually, is Wilson with you" Jacob replied.

"No bastard escaped, but we need to get out here now" The voice said

"You heard her Shepard, we need to go. I'll take you to my boss, he can explain more" Jacob said. They made their way to the shuttle, where a tall, brunette, Australian woman was waiting. Shepard thought she must have been really tall, to be the same height, at first, until she remembered her new actual height. "She's rally not that different from me now" Shepard thought.

"My name is Miranda Lawson, I brought you back from the dead. Anything else you should know" Miranda asked with an almost bored tone.

"Where's Cerberus going to take me now" You retorted.

"Ah Jacob, I knew your consience would get the better of you" Miranda said cynically.

"She figured out before I could tell her. We need to stop putting our symbol on all of our stuff" Jacob said.

"hmmm, fair enough. Anything else you want to know" Miranda asked.

"Lets go meet your boss" Shepard demanded.

"Agreed" Miranda said
12111112111.title: Back from the dead......sort of

121111121111.content:
"You have to understand Shepard, this was the only way to bring you back" The illusive man tried to explain.

"As Ashley, Cerberus with all your resources couldn't find any other options" Shepard replied angrily.

The two had been arguing with each other for well over half an hour. Shepard was becoming increasingly frustrated by the truth that the illusive man was giving her. Her life as commander Shepard was over and yet not at the same time.

"It doesn't really matter at the end of the day. Like or not were at war. Humanity is under attack by the very enemy the council wants to forget"

She didn't want to admit it but, the illusive man had a point. "The reapers" Shepard spat out.

"Exactly. Entire human colonies are disappearing without a trace. You saw freedom's progress, not a single human left, and these are just small colonies." The illusive man explained

It was true. Before arriving at a Cerberus base, reports came in of freedom's progress going dark. At Jacob's insistance, we had made a quick landing only discovering that every man, woman, and child had simply vanished and security footage that told a more gruesome story.

"I know of the collectors, the ghost stories, but do you think they could really be connected with the reapers?" Shepard asked.

"Does it matter, all we know are two distinct groups that have an unusual intrest in humanity, and humans are disappearing. Isn't that enough to wonder" the Illusive man retorted.

Shepard took this in. "Fair enough, but where does this leave me in the equation?"

"You know the reapers better than anyone else in the galaxy, you've seen what they intend to do with us. I need you to investigate the collector attacks, find if they have a connection with the reapers, and most importantly stop them."

"Why talk to the alliance or even the council about this?" Shepard inquired

"They refuse to pledge any resources to this situation. If you can convince them otherwise be my guest. Just remember as far as they are concerned, the reaper threat died with commander Shepard." The illusive man responded.

"Exactly, how am I supposed to walk around as Ashley now. I may look like her, sound like her, but I certainly don't act or think like her. Plus she died on Vermire to begin with. How do we explain her suddenly just walking around" Shepard asked very concerned.

"Ashley Williams was never declared dead" the illusive man said slightly annoyed. "After stealing the ship to Ilos, and the subsequent mass death and confusion in the aftermath of Sovereign's invasion, the alliance somehow never got around to it. After Miranda discovered Ashley's 'usefulness' we spread rumors that she somehow survived Vermire, quit the Alliance and was currently working as a freelancer in the terminus systems"

Shepard was dumbfounded. "They actually bought that"

"It wouldn't be the first time it happened to an Alliance solider. Hell, its not the first time you disappeared yourself" The illusive man tried to say.

"Don't speak about Akuze" Shepard demanded. For the first time the illusive man was taken aback

"But you get my point. It will be fine, were dealing with the family as we speak and will continue to do so"

"Deal with them how" Shepard inquired.

"Don't. worry. about. it." The illusive man demanded himself. "As far as Ashley's psych profile and history, we can send you detailed notes"

Shepard was furious, yet couldn't help but agree with some of what the illusive man was saying. "How do I go about defeating the collectors"

For the first time the Illusive man smiled. "We have a ship and crew ready for you. I've assembled some dossiers to help build a team to help you in your mission"

"What about my old team" Shepard asked.

"Most of them dropped off the map or were reassigned after the battle of the citadel. If you encounter them in your travels, i'll let you have the final judgement call, but just remember, they've moved on and may not reconigize the new you" The illusive man explained.

Massive understatement Shepard thought "So if seems you have everything planed out for me, what if I refuse" Shepard asked curiously.

"You awalys have a choice Shepard. You can say no and i'll put you on a shuttle to the nearest spaceport and you can forget this conversation ever happened." The illusive man explained once again. "Regardless of what you think of me or Cerberus, the attacks supersede any boundaries for the sake of humanity."

Shepard screamed on the inside. She hated to admit it but the Illusive man was right. After what she saw at freedom's progress, the attacks were too big to ignore. Even if it meant working with Cerberus. "I'll work with you, for humanity, not for Cerberus" Shepard explained.

"Fair enough" The illusive man said "Before you leave though two things. One: It may be better to go by Ashley now in case someone recognizes you"

Shepard simply glared at him.

"But I let you make that call" the illusive man said hastily. "Two: I found you a pilot. He's one of the best and you've already met"

With that the Illusive man abruptly ended the conference, and left Shepard alone in projection room.

"Didn't even have the decency to talk face to face" A vice said behind Shepard.

Shepard turned around and was shocked again. "Joker?"

Joker leaned against the wall of the staircase grinning from ear to ear. "You look better Shepard, or Ashley"

"Well....I.....uh..you see.....umm" Shepard stuttered to say.

"Relax" said Joker "I know everything"

"And you went along with it anyway" Shepard asked.

"Really" Shepard questioned.

"Well, there was some disbelief and smashing of things at first, but yeah. It's definitely weird and will take some getting used to, but if that's Shepard in there, hell yeah i'm game" Joker said still grinning.

This was the first happy moment Shepard had in a while. "I assume you joined because of the reapers"

Joker's grin faded instantly "It pisses me off that the alliance is doing nothing" Joker said while walking up the stairs. "After Alchera they just wanted everything gone. Records were sealed, the team broken up, they tried to make it look like nothing happened."

"So you trust Cerberus" Shepard asked.

"Well, I trust anyone with a higher pay grade than me, but when were taking the fight to the collectors, hell yeah I joined with Cerberus, and they have the best toys" Joker said

"Oh"

"Come" Joker said walking over to a glass window. "They only told me about it last night"

At the the flick of a switch the lights came on to reveal a brand new normandy sitting in a dry dock.

"It's good to be home huh, Shepard"
121111121111.title: Revalations

1211111211112.content:
Shepard received the grand tour of the new Normandy. Although nervous at first, it turned out to be her first real comfort. It was like being at home once again. They had finally regrouped in the CIC.

"So this is the new Normandy and all her new enhancements. Any more questions Shepard." Miranda asked.

"No you explained everything in perfect detail as usual Miranda" Shepard said mockingly.

Miranda was not fazed. "Good, the captain's cabin is on the 1st floor in the elevator. You'll probably want to get out that armor and adjusted to your new clothes soon." Miranda retorted. "If you have any further questions you can find me in my office on the 3rd floor." And with that she abruptly walked away.

"You'll have to excuse her" Jacob said. "She an excellent officer, but can be a bit of an ice queen sometimes."

Shepard smiled and raised an eyebrow.

"Okay, she is an ice queen, but don't let it get to you" Jacob explained "If you need me, i'm awalys in the armory on this floor." With that he excused himself.

"Where should we begin first" asked EDI, the resident AI.

This I will never get used to Shepard thought. "Let's begin in Omega, i'm curious to meet this Archangel fellow, and we need Mordin to counteract the seeker swarms"

"Charting a course, Shepard" EDI said before logging off.

----------

“Well, this has been an eventful few days” Shepard thought. “At least I can get this damn armor off”

Shepard quickly stripped off her armor, revealing the pert orbs hanging off Shepard's curvy lithe body. Shepard made a mental sigh, before opening the armor locker. However, Shepard was suprised to see that most of the clothes provided for her were typical military dress. A standard crewman's outfit, officer's suit, even an off duty outfit from her spacer days. Well there was two exceptions. A skin tight blue officer's uniform and a blue dress hung in there as well. Where, have I seen these before I thought Shepard thought. She then remembered a memo being sent to her a few months before Eden Prime, of new uniforms for female officers of major or higher. Shepard remembered a phone call with her mother, how she thought that the brass was more interested in the officers showing off, rather than being functional. “Oh, mom...” Shepard thought, realizing that she would never see her mom or any of her family again. At least not as Commander Shepard.

Quickly, she put the two uniforms away and just slipped into the standard crew uniform. Shepard went to her desk and opened the Ashley's phych profiles on the terminal. “If I’m going to be her, may as well play the part.” Shepard thought dejectedly.

-----------

Shepard had to give credit to Cerberus, she had learned more about Ashley than she ever did aboard the original Normandy. However, that was just the problem. She was learning to be someone else than who she actually was. Someone that she allowed to die under her command. Hell, she hadn't even looked in a mirror since when she woke up. Shepard was about to forget everything when someone pinged the door and a short redhead walked in.

"Commander, I'm yeoman Kelly Chambers" the woman said.

"Hello, Ms. Chambers, what are you doing here" Shepard asked annoyed but also curious at the same time.

"Please, Kelly" she said. "I'm the ship's yeoman, that means I’m the resident physiologist. My job is to make sure the crew is in good mental health for the mission. I specialize in Human, Turian, and Asari, physiology and Alien-Human relations."

"To make sure everyone stays in shape for when we start picking up our non-human crew" Shepard asked curiously.

"Exactly" Kelly replied.

"Good to know, but you still haven't answered my question. What are you doing here?” Shepard asked again.

"Well, I manage the mental health of our crew, but you have special circumstances. I need to make sure your adjusting properly to the...change shall we say" Kelly explained.

Always, a catch with Cerberus Shepard thought. Someone to keep an eye on him, naturally. However, she thought it might be good have someone to help adjust. “I'll play along for now” Shepard concluded cautiously.

"Very well, what did you want to ask me" Shepard asked.

"Well, how are you feeling so far" Kelly asked.

"Other than constantly being trapped in the body of a friend I let die and being the wrong gender, everything is fine I suppose" Shepard replied.

"Understandable" Kelly replied. "At least physically you are adjusting to the body extordinarily well. Based on what happened what happened when you woke up, I can clear you for combat service. But that's not really the point. I'm here to help you get used to your new form. It's a very large change, and you need to be comfortable with yourself if you want to have a chance of completing the mission" Kelly explained.

She has a point Shepard thought. "Just through some periodic checkin's and scheduled exercises. Also for the first month you'll most likely need me for some of the more feminine aspects of the female body" Kelly explained again.

"Ok then" Shepard said, not wanting to discuss those "aspects". "When are we going to begin said exercises’?”

"Right now, just a simple one" Kelly said. She pulled out a compact mirror and held it up to Shepard's face. "What do you see?” Kelly asked.

"Oh...umm" Shepard said perplexed. In the mirror Shepard saw her face again for the first time since she woke up. Ashley's face staring back at her in the mirror copying her every movement. "A face that isn't mine" Shepard finally said.

"Good" Kelly said. "Just to start out first, it would not be a bad idea to just frankly look at yourself once in awhile"

"What" Shepard said confused.

"Stare at yourself in the mirror or at you’re at your body, just to get used to the fact that this is you now. The sooner you subconsciously accept that this is you now, you can get on with your life" Kelly said.

Shepard let all of this sink in. "Thank you Kelly, I think you'll be a valuable member of this crew"

"Oh, thank you commander. Now I need to return to my other duties, but you can always find me in the CIC if you need me" Kelly said before walking out.

Shepard was alone once again, with the reality of her being Ashley sinking in further.
1211111211112.title: Retire to the captain's cabin

12111112111121.content:
"Shepard we'll arrive at Omega in one hour" EDI said in her emotionless voice.

"Thank you EDI" Shepard replied. Well, the first mission, Shepard thought. It was the first real opportunity for a potentially dangerous situation since waking up. Not that she was worried, Shepard had brought herself back up to speed with live fire exercises with Jacob and those shitty training videos Miranda provided. No, this was the first time she was going out in public for the first time, as someone else. Shepard had been dreading since issuing the order to go to Omega. Kelly had helped somewhat with it in the sessions they had been having the last week.

--------
Three days earlier

"But the way I walk is different won't people notice" Shepard asked.

"Perhaps, but your a solider so it's to be expected" Kelly said. "Besides Ashley was awalys known for being a.....ah...well.."

"Tomboy" Shepard chimed in.

"I wasn't going to...but yeah" Kelly said flustered. "Regardless, her reputation as well as your personality are what's going to matter in the long run anyway"

"Okay, but what if I have to actually...um... dress up or.....ah...look pretty" Shepard asked worried.

Kelly just smiled. "Even Miranda can't wear make up for every day of the mission, but we'll cross that bridge when we get to it."

"And about my hair" Shepard asked pulling a long lock towards at her face.

"Many girls put it up but, you can wear it down even in battle" Kelly explained.

--------

The thing Shepard wasn't happy about was her officer's uniform. She intentionally avoided it from day one. However, Miranda complained that Shepard should wear it while on away missions, to show her status as the commander. Kelly tried to talk Miranda out of it, but eventually Shepard had to come to a compromise. She had to wear the uniform if entering at a spaceport, and that was final.

"Exactly, what I didn't need" Shepard thought. She drank the poison and slipped into the uniform. It was custom tailored for her fitting like a second skin. Looking in the mirror, Shepard saw a better version of Ashley, more confident, and (secretly) a sexier version of her. Shepard erased the thought from her mind and went to join the boarding party.

--------

Shepard, Jacob, and Miranda walked through the hallway, before being stopped by a Batarian. "So the great Williams, shows up to our station, your lucky you've made it this far." The Batatian said snidely.

"Oh, why" Shepard retorted. "Am I in that much demand"

"Heh, no. You alliance types are obliterated if you get within half a light year of this place, but Aria has an interest in you" The batarian replied. "Get your plump ass to afterlife, she wants to speak to you"

Shepard ignored the insult. "And if I decline" She asked.

"Then i'm the least of your problems. Afterlife. Now." And with that he left.

"Warm welcome" Miranda commented.

"Com'on let's find this Aria"

--------

Afterlife wasn't that hard to find apparently, one elevator ride led them to afterlife, and island in sea of crowded hallways, apartments, and districts that led to the unknown.

"For the head of a criminal enterprise, she sure doesn't keep a low profile" Jacob commented.

"Well, hopefully she has connections to find archangel and the doctor" Shepard replied. The bouncers were obviously briefed on "Ashley's group" and had no trouble getting into the club. What they did have a problem with was talking to Aria.

"That's far enough" Aria said, as Shepard approached her. Aria's cronies began to search for weapons (despite assault rifles, shotguns, pistols, and sniper rifles on their backs). Shepard merely punched one of them out and continued to walk to Aria. HEr bodyguards pulled out all their weapons but Aria was unfazed.

"Ashley you live up to your name, even it could have cost you your life" Aria said with a twinge of impressment.

"Please you wouldn't kill me, your the reason why I'm here" Shepard replied.

"A dangerous gamble but with spunk, I like that" Aria said as she motioned for Shepard to sit as everyone lowered their weapons.

"So why are you here Williams" Aria asked.

"I'm looking for two people, Archangel an--"

"You and half of Omega want him dead too so get in line" Aria said.

"Actually, I'm recruiting him for a mission" Shepard explained.

"Really, how unusual" Aria said. "There's a recruitment room downstairs, the merc groups are hiring anyone with a gun to go after him at this point"

"Why" Miranda asked.

"Archangel has managed to piss off the three biggest merc groups, and single handedly cut down Omega's trade output by 8%. The sooner you get him off the station, the better for all of us" Aria explained angrily.

"What about Doctor Solus" Shepard asked.

"I liked the good doctor" Aria said "He's as likely to shoot you as he is to heal you, back from when he worked in STG. He opened a clinic on the 14th floor to combat the plague"

"Plague" Jacob asked.

Aria nodded. "Popped up a few weeks ago. Affects everyone except humans and the Vorcha. Since no one wants a successful Vorcha colony, would you kindly tell Solus to hurry up on his cure" Aria explained.

"We'll see what we can do" Shepard said as she stood up.

"So where to first" Miranda asked.
12111112111121.title: Arrive at Omega

1211111212.content: Ashley survived. Does she know about the new Shepard
1211111212.title: Yes

121111122.content: How about Kelly Chambers then? Remember, she probably got one-on-one with a Varren (and got scale itch from that encounter)!
121111122.title: Nah, she hasn't gotten hot yet!

choices: Shepard is greeted by the treacherous Dr. Wilson
Shepard is answered by his savior, Miranda
1211112.content:
Pain.

Every inch, every cell of Shepard's body was exploding in pain. The commander had thought his pain was over after he had slipped into what he thought was an eternal sleep after blacking out after the attack on the Normandy. But now the pain was back and was worse than ever before. All he could do was scream in an attempt to release some of it. The pain was so intense he couldn't even hear the voices panicking above him. Shepard didn't even notice the syringe injecting him with an agent knocking him into a coma so that he couldn't feel anything.

"Wilson! What's wrong! That's the 5th time you've failed to bring Shepard back. Why does this keep happening?" Miranda shouted to the medical officer as Shepard slipped into a deep sleep.

"What did you expect! All of his cells as they are now are dead or dying and nothing can change that! That's the sort of thing that hurts a great deal. If we keeping trying to revive him all he can do is just die again in increasingly painful facions! Just give up already!"

"What if we changed the cells? In fact change him all together. If Shepard is a new person than perhaps that would work."

"That's not what the Illusive Man wants."

"A body is merely a body. We'll leave the mind untouched. Hopefully that will be enough to revive the legendary hero."

"I don't know, we should probably just give up."

"If you feel that way then you can be reassigned, I'll run everything."

"But I don't'..."

"Get out Wilson." Miranda said with a cold voice that Wilson knew meant trouble if he challenge her. I'll have to stop this mad project another way. Wilson thought as he left Miranda to her work.

"Now, what will be the most effect way to make the needed changes." Miranda said as she examined the many screens displaying every bit of biological data on Shepard. After hours and hours of keeping her eyes on biological and genetic readings before letting out a sigh knowing a potential answer to her problem, "We, it is only one chromosome." Miranda said before getting to work.
__________________________________________________

Two year later

Once again Shepard felt himself coming into consciousness for the first time in a long time that he'd felt something that wasn't excruciating pain. Although now that he was alive and not in pain he didn't know what to do about it. It was as if he'd forgotten how to move his body. But Shepard didn't want to worry about that for now. He could just sit back and enjoy the feeling of being alive and just relax. However this relaxation wouldn't last long as Shepard thought, The crew!. Out of nowhere he found the energy and inspiration needed to move again and jumped off of the bed he was laying on and took a look around. He was obviously in a medical room, but it didn't have the layout of any hospital he knew. Perhaps it's a med bay at a military base. Shepard concluded as he wiped the red bangs out of his eyes. Bangs? I had a military crew cut just before the last mission. How long was I out? Shepard took a step to the door but wavered a little in his steps. Part of it was not having moved in who knows how long, but something else was different. My balance is...off. Shepard thought as he looked around the room and noticed a mirror. But it couldn't be a mirror, what was looking back at him was a red haired woman. "What?" Shepard said and saw the red haired woman also say it. "This isn't possible." Shepard said as he approached the mirror, but before he could take it all in an alarm sounded and a voice came over the intercom.

"Shepard!? You're awake?! Well perfect timing I guess, I need your help. Grab the gun at the desk and come help me out!"

"Who are you?" Shepard called out looking for as many answers as he(?) could find.
1211112.title: Shepard's revived with a surprise

121112.content: The Lazarus Project! What Shepard winds up is...
121112.title: Lazarus Project with a synthetic?

1211121.content: The Lazarus Project! What Shepard winds up as is a synthetic!
1211121.title: A synthetic!

choices: Shepard soon woke up in the new facility
12111211.content:
Shepard slowly came to, hearing murmurs about the body being non-salvageable, too much damage, he rolled his vision to a rather beautiful looking woman standing there, saying something about there needing to be more time. A man interrupting as the two got into an argument, he could feel his vision blur as his heart rate rose, the two turning their attention to Shepard, dosing him with more sedatives, his vision began to fade.

Miranda and the doctor realized that they needed to do more to save him, they turned their attention towards possibly inserting them in an infiltration unit previously meant to infiltrate a base on Mars, complete with identity and forged documents, Eva Core. They filed for a request and it was nearly immediately granted, the synthetic female form was transferred over to the medical center, being prepped and readied to support a human brain. The process was fairly straightforward, the AI core removed and replaced with Shepard's brain.

http://pixologic.com/interview/mass-effe...

After Shepard's brain was loaded the synthetic unit was closed up and sealed. Eva was then sorted out with clothing, getting a suit very similar to Miranda's with extra gear attached to it, the boots were then slipped on and the new Commander Eva Core was transferred to another medical facility.

12111212.content: How about he gets turned into a type of software, similar to the geth, but besides entering other synthetic objects, he can also enter organics.
12111212.title: Something else

121112121.content:
Cerberus picked him up,well as much as they could as most his body was beyond repair,so they did the only thing they could do, which was to put him inside of a machine.
One of the Cerberus scientists can over and examined Shepard's new body and said, "It looks like it took the procedure well. His mind is fully intact. Begin phase 2, and upload his full personality.

"Where am I and who are you" Shepard said upon awaking. He didn't notice his strange body, but he noticed a robotic sound to his voice. He looked around the room as the scientists uploaded a HUD to him.

"Hello, I'm a scientist who works for Cerberus. We recovered your body from the Normandy crash from two years ago. Unfortunately your body was beyond repair, although we were able to save your mind. This Geth unit was the only thing we could find in time to be able and save you. But don't worry, we will give you a full training course on your new body, after you talk with our leader."


(*Footnote: Shepard look Cerberus copy of the Geth,So he has White Paint with Black Paint cause it The style of Cerberus)

Shepard wave his new arms in matter-of-fact attitude

1211121212.title: "How did this happen?"

12111212122.content:
"Ok, this is going to be a key part of your new body" the Cerberus scientist said, "This Geth has been edited so that you can enter your mind into other synthetic or organic. The synthetic part is easy, as all you have to do is insert one of your fingers into an induction port. Once you do that, your body will take over and project yourself into it. However, once you do that, your body cannot move, until you reenter it, by thinking about it. The best way to deal with this is to have your squad mates look after it. The same goes for Organics, although they must be unconsciousness or asleep for the transfer to work "

"Alright, that seems simple enough." Shepard said, internally shuddering at his new voice, "But won't I be a bit noticeable walking around as a Geth?"

121112121221122221112122.content:
Shepard pulled up a database with files on the crew of the Normandy SR-2. He recognized a few names: Jeff Moreau, Kelly Chambers and Karin Chakwas. However there were many that were new to him: Miranda Lawson, Jacob Taylor, Kenneth Donnelly, Gabriella Daniels, Rupert Gardner, Sarah Patel, Vadim Rolston, Jenny Goldstein, Thomas Hawthorne, Richard Hadley, and Zach Matthews among many others.

"Now I just look at a file and select it, correct?" Shepard's robotic voice asked.

"I believe so, Commander." Dr. Chakwas replied, "At least according to my files here."

Shepard then selected one of the files and suddenly his body began changing. His geth frame readjusted into more of a human skeletal structure while muscles, tendons, skin and hair emerged to cover it. On top of that clothing: underwear and a uniform like the other crewmembers of the Normandy SR-2. "Whoa, that was something huh? How do I look, Doc?" Shepard asked in a much higher-pitched voice.

"Like Engineer Daniels." Dr. Chakwas stated, "Gabriella."

"Gabby, actually. It's what she prefers." Shepard said. "It's in the files plus it's weird it's like... I can pull up a digital copy of her mind. If I wanted to I could impersonate her perfectly. And I'm surprised about this. I thought it would be some kind of hard light hologram, but it feels like I'm actual flesh and blood."

"That's because you are." said the doctor, "In a way at least. The files say that this geth unit has been heavily modified for infiltration purposes and as such it's equipped with an internal fabricator that can create inorganic matter similar to that used by the geth hoppers you encountered while fighting Saren. It's just a far more advanced form that can become nearly indistinguishable from muscle, skin, hair, and material used for clothing. You can even emit a substance that simulates saliva and that unit is equipped with special sensors and programming that wil similuate the sense of touch."

"This is amazing." Shepard stated.

"It is and to see just how amazing it is I'm going to have you transform one more time." Dr. Chakwas said, "This time I want you to transform into an alien. Not an asari, too close to humans, but any other race should be fine. We need to see how it does handling non-human or close to human forms."

Shepard nodded and opened up files once more. His now computer mind allowed him to search through them at great speed and he quickly found the one he wanted and initated the transformation. "Keelah, it worked." Shepard said as he stared at his new hands in amazement: thin and with only three fingers.

"I had a feeling that you would choose Tali'Zorah's form." Dr. Chakwas said. "But a quarian form is good. Vastly different from a human's."

With that the tests were over and Dr. Chakwas bid goodbye to Shepard. Shepard was now wondering what to do. He wondered if he should keep Tali's form for the time being, it felt nice and it would get the crew used to working with aliens. However he knew he'd need a human form in order to do what Cerberus had asked him to do. Taking somebody more high profile like Ashley or Anderson could prove to be dangerous if they're seen as being in two places at once so if he needed a human form he'd need someone a little more... out of the way.

Tali's form made him remember their chasing of Saren which made him remember somebody: Lizbeth Baynham. He met her while saving the Zhu's Hope colony on Feros from a geth attack. She worked for ExoGeni which worked heavily with the Alliance to help colonize new worlds and research new worlds for colonization. With ExoGeni's relationship with the Alliance he might be able to move around Alliance systems with less suspicion as Lizbeth.

But he'd need to fight too and from what he remembered Lizbeth wasn't made for fighting. But then Shepard remembered Noveria: someone like Maeko Matsuo or (the now deceased) Kaira Stirling would be a good shape to take for combat with the bonus of being human and making it a bit easier to move around. Just not with anywhere near the level of convenience Lizbeth's form would provide.

"Miss Lawson, we have a problem." Wilson announced as he approached Miranda with a datapad in hand.

"What is it, Wilson?" Miranda asked, irritation evident in her tone.

"The blood transfusion seems to failed." Wilson explained nervously.

"Then try it again with a different blood type." Miranda barked back at him.

"That's just it, we've attempted it with every compatible blood type, and none of them worked." Wilson elaborated, showing Miranda the contents of his datapad. "It seems the damage to Commander Shepard's circulatory system is too great to allow for blood flow."

"Damn. We were so close. We need options. The Illusive Man will not accept failure on this." Miranda insisted.

"Some of the scientists have theorized that the Element Zero present in Asari blood might repair the arteries as the bloods flows through his system. However, we have no way of knowing what kind of side effects-" Wilson suggested before Miranda cut him off.

"Do it." she ordered.

Several weeks later

"Report." Miranda said to Wilson as he stepped into her office.

"Well, I've got good news and bad news. The good news is the transfusion worked, and the eezo has greatly accelerated the healing process. The bad news, however, is that it's triggered some sort of cascade reaction, and it's completely rewriting his genetic structure." Wilson explained, backing his statements with several images on a datapad, including photographs of Shepard's body, and scans of his DNA. In the photos, it appeared as if Shepard was slowly transforming an Asari.

"My god. I should have listened to your warning about side effects." Miranda commented as she examined the images. "Can reverse it."

"Unfortunately, no. His heart's producing nothing but Asari blood, and transfusing human blood doesn't have any effect." Wilson added.

"What about his brain?" Miranda asked.

"Genetically, it's undergoing the same changes as the rest of his body, but his memories and personality appear to be intact. Regardless of what's happening to his body, he'll still be Commander Shepard." Wilson pointed out.

Under what circumstances should Shepard regain consciousness

1211122211.content:
In the privacy of his study, the Illusive Man considered his options. The Lazarus Project was not going according to plan. The Commander's body was write off, beyond repair - cooked on the outside, broken and pulverized on the inside, its cells irradiated by cosmic rays. The only part that had been salvageable was the brain. The team had successfully extracted it and it currently stewed in a nutrient bath, rejuvenating.

With a press of a button, the Illusive Man conjured a hologram of Shepard's cerebrum. Inside there was everything he needed; the commander's tactical acumen, his connections, his knowledge of the reapers and the protheans. If he could somehow transfer all that into a new, strong body, one with unconditional loyalty to Cerberus and its cause, the Project would be a success. And it would have to be a body with enough spare room in it to accommodate a grown man's brain. Where would he find a body to match such specifications?

As if on cue, an incoming transmission interrupted his thoughts. "This is Miranda Lawson reporting in. Commander Shepard's brain has been stabilized. Would you like us to begin growing a clone body?"

"No, that will take more time than we have. I have something else in mind..."
-------
It was certainly one of the oddest surgeries he had undertaken, but Dr Wilson wasn't complaining. He had Miranda, that smug ice queen, right where he wanted her, laid out unconscious on an operating table, an excuse to put his hands all over that ass of hers. They had operated all night, inserting the neural tissue, connecting it to Miranda's nervous system, folding the gluteus muscles back, sealing the Commander's brain inside, and stitching the skin together until her ass was as perfect as it ever had been. No one would have ever guessed the Galaxy's last best hope was currently residing in it.

With the surgery over, he attached the cortical stimulators to the ass, took a step back, and activated them. The electrical charge sent a delightful ripple of motion through the beautiful butt cheeks and (he hoped) brought the brain inside to consciousness.

14311111.content:
Shepard entered the lab as the entire structure was shaking from damage caused by the Reaper Destroyer, "Mordin, is the cure ready?"

"Yes. Loaded for dispersal in two minutes. Procedure traumatic for Eve, but not lethal. Maelon's research invaluable." The Salarian scientist said in a hurried tone.

"She's okay?"

"Headed to safety now." Mordin didn't look up from the computer terminal. "Her survival fortunate. Will stabilize new government should Wrex get any ideas. Good match, promising future for krogan."

Just then a burning piece of debris fell, "Damn." Shepard said, shielding his eyes from smoke.

"Control room at top of Shroud tower. Must take elevator up."

"You're going up there?" Shepard asked his friend in disbelief.

"Yes. Manual access required. Have to counteract STG sabotage. Ensure cure dispersed properly."

"Mordin, this whole thing is coming apart. There's got to be another way!"

"Remote bypass impossible. STG countermeasures in place. No time to adjust cure for temperature variance." Mordin turned away from Shepard. "No. No other option. Not coming back. Suggest you get clear. Explosions likely to be problematic."

"Mordin, no."

"Shepard, please. Need to do this. My project. My work. My cure. My responsibility. Would have liked to see how it ends. Sure you'll do fine without me."

"I'm sorry-"

"I'm not. Had to be me." Mordin smiles, "Someone else might have gotten it wrong." With that, the salarian activated the elevator, ascending up the monolithic tower, still burning from the lightening strikes.

On the ground, Shepard reunited with his squad, and Wrex and Eve and other krogan. An explosion at the top of the tower meant that Mordin had perished, but flakes of white powder raining down from the Shroud proved that Mordin has succeeded at dispersing the cure genophage cure.

Wrex reached his hand out to collect some of the dust. "Truly a miracle," the krogan said in his gruff voice.

"Truly it is," Eve agreed next to him.

"I think I can feel it working right now." Wrex continued. "...WAIT. Something's wrong!" The scarred krogan began feeling sick, his armor weighing him down heavily. His vision was fading, but before his sight completely filled with black he noticed some of the muscle mass in his arm diminishing.

"Wrex, what's happening?" Shepard asked. "Wrex?" But not long after Wrex collapsed, so did the other krogan present, including Eve.

Garrus looked at the krogan laying on the ground, then turned towards the Commander, "Shepard, do you think Mordin's cure is causing this sickness?"

Shepard grimaced at this prospect, "I hate to think so Garrus, but that's probably it, and with Mordin gone. I don't know what we're going to do. We'll have to find another geneticist who knows Mordin's work. But... I think we should know for sure if Mordin is actually dead."

They headed up to the Shroud's command control room. Did they find Mordin alive or dead?
14311111.title: The Shroud

choices: Dr. Chakwas notices something strange in the DNA samples
143111111.content:
As Shepard, Garrus and Liara rush back to the burning tower, they are dismayed to find nothing but a fiery ruin. Nothing could have survived the explosion. Thinking on the fly, Commander Shepard calls for evac, bringing Wrex and Eve back to the Normandy so Dr. Chakwas could run some tests, and scour the lab for any clues Mordin might have left.

They find dragging the unconscious Krogan easier than expected. "Is it just me" Garrus remarks, "or are they smaller than usual?". Shepard took another look, and to his astonishment Garrus was correct. Wrex and Eve, while not human sized, had lost several inches in height, and appeared to still be shrinking! "We have to hurry" shouted the Commander, "Double time!".

The transport shuttles flew as fast as they could, and the Krogans were swiftly brought to the Med-Bay for examination. Meanwhile, Shepard, with the assistance of EDI, searched for clues left behind by the former Dr. Solus.

Who discovers something first?
143111111.title: Mordin is dead. What now?

choices: She's managed to figure out whose DNA this is: Miranda's.
The reprogrammed genophage is in the air still, changing everyone.
1431111112.content:
Since they'd cleared there way there before, heading back down to Tuchanka to the ruins of the building that had ended the genophage wasn't too difficult at all. Scanning around the building, Shepard and EDI looked for any trace, any answer to what was going on. Then, they hit paydirt: a datalog from Mordin. "Shepard, this is urgent. If you're hearing this, it means I am currently deceased, and I have failed. The cure was sabotaged, the DNA used to fix the broken genes switched out for another's entirely. I still am not sure whose it is, but it appears to be human. You must-" But then an explosion cut off the sound, and Shepard and EDI were left standing alone in the ruins.

With a slightly better understanding of what was going on, Shepard and EDI left with the datalog and got back to the Normandy. He rushed down to sickbay, only to find Wrex and Eve were changed even further. It was obvious that they weren't really Krogan anymore, much smaller and sleeker, with the beginnings of hair on their still scaly heads. They also looked incredibly like each other, making Shepard think that the DNA was from a single person, that all the Krogan might be becoming copies of one human. He told Chakwas, but she had news for him as well.
1431111112.title: Unexpected Data

choices: Shepard tries to contact the Illusive Man to help the Krograns.
Shepard decides to wait and see what Wrex and Eve think.
14311111121.content:
The Normandy’s longtime doctor looked over the datalog, and it didn’t appear to be making her very happy. “It’s as I feared. I was able to isolate the exact gene sequences in both patients, and it didn’t take long running them through our database to find something similar. It seems the saboteur used the DNA of Miranda Lawson.” That name was a shock to Shepard, his previously assigned number two from when he was briefly working with Cerberus. That narrowed down exactly who was doing this.

“Is there anything we can do about this?” Shepard asked. His eyes wandered over to the two patients on the table, and he couldn’t help seeing now the beginnings of their more Miranda-like features taking shape. For a moment, he even got excited about the effect this would have, but he shook his head and tried to focus on helping them, not how hot it would be to have more Miranda Lawson’s running about.

His question wasn’t well-received by Chakwas, who gave him a stern look. “Commander, I appreciate your confidence, but I’m a medical doctor. What’s happening to these two is beyond anything I’ve ever seen or heard of before. The only way it was possible was because of Mordin’s genius and the mechanical wonder he used to try and cure the genophage. With him dead and it gone, I can’t think of any way to possibly fix this.” Shepard knew she had a point, but he also knew that it was unlikely the Illusive Man would have done something like this without a way to change them back. Was it worth bargaining with a madman to try and save them?
14311111121.title: The Lawson Revelation

choices: Wrex and Eve refuse, they’ll find their own cure.
Wrex and Eve agree, Shepard seeks his foe.
143111111212.content:
As much as Commander Shepard wanted to, as was usual for him, try and take this problem by the reigns and solve it all himself, even he had to admit that wouldn’t be the best idea. An entire species had been suddenly inflicted with a strange and dangerous transformation, and not just any species, but the Krogan. These were a people who had been maligned and paternalized ever since they’d first been uplifted, and who even now more the physical and mental scars of that treatment. Wrex was his friend, and he wouldn’t do anything until the leader of the Urdnot Clan and Eve had woken up, so he could hear directly from them.

It was a stressful day and a half, but Shepard finally got the message from Chakwas: they were both awake and wanted to speak with him. Feeling more than a little nervous, Shepard got on the elevator from his personal room and was soon in the medbay. Neither Krogan looked much like their species anymore. Instead, two clones of Miranda Lawson, barely clothes in medical gowns, waited for him. The changes weren’t complete yet: both were larger than the real Miranda, with some scales (especially around the head) and sharper teeth. But other than that, they looked like the Cerberus agent.

One of them was standing near a wall, looking at Shepard with mild interest, while the other was pacing, their face stoic but their mood evidently angry. It didn’t take much for Shepard to assume the latter was Wrex, and the former Eve. Once Shepard was in the room, Wrex turned his attention on him, and started speaking. “Shepard. Mind telling me what the hell’s going on?!” The voice and mannerisms from Wrex threw Shepard for a loop. He sounded like Miranda, without the accent, but a little deeper and more gravely, and it was clear the ex-Krogan didn’t know how to manipulate his new human face in the way he used to with muzzle. It made sense, Shepard supposed, since Krogan’s didn’t have a lot of facial expression, at least to human eyes.

One explanation on everything that had happened either, and Wrex had punched the wall, before wincing in pain due to how much it had hurt him. Meanwhile, Eve took over talking to Shepard. “It seems that, once again, the Krogan’s fate has been tampered with by outside meddlars, even as others try to help us. Do you have any possible solutions for us, Commander?” Tentatively, Shepard explained that it was possible for the Illusive Man, who was no doubt behind this, to also reverse it. The only question was how they’d take the idea.
143111111212.title: Asking the "Krogans"

14311112.content:
Shepard was feeling pretty good with himself. He had just cured the genophage, and managed to save his good friend Mordin Solus at the same time. However, as he was walking towards the bridge to have a talk with Joker, and EDI, Samantha Traynor told him that Mordin wanted to see him in the Med-Bay before they went to drop him off at the Citadel. Shepard was expecting a routine visit, where his friend would just say the usual remarks and be done with it, but when he arrived, he noticed that Mordin had a worried look on his face. "What's wrong?" Shepard asked. "Genophage cure. Possible contamination." Mordin blasted out as he fiddled around the bay. "Wait, what do you mean, contamination?" Shepard inquired. "well, I created a small dose of cure for Wrex. Just to examine for possible side effects. However, after examining the other half of dose. There was a small contamination that will dramatically affect Wrex." Mordin replied. "wait, so he won't be cured? Shepard asked, starting to get angry.

"No, no. Will still be cured. Just not in the way he expected, is all". "OK then, so what was the containment anyways, and what will happen to Wrex?" Shepard asked for one last time. "Well, you probably won't be happy, but when I was on board the Normandy for the suicide mission, I collected DNA samples from all of the crew mates. In case of emergency transplants or repeat of Lazarus Project. Unfortunately, one of the samples got mixed in with the sample Wrex drank. The DNA was from Ms. Lawson" "WHAT?" Shepard exploded , "You collected DNA from all of the crew mates, even me, without telling me?!" "I apologize Shepard, but that is not the only problem. the DNA from Ms. Lawson mixed in, because the cure thought it was a task requirement. This means that Wrex will slowly transform into a physical copy of Ms. Lawson" "Shit, we need to hurry then!" Shepard said with the utmost urgency, "EDI, patch me in to Wrex from the com room, I need to talk to him!" "Very well then" EDI said

143111122.content:
As soon as Shepard exited the Med-Bay in order to head towards the elevator his thoughts stayed on Miranda Lawson for a moment.

Miranda... he thought as the painful memory of her death hit him again.

***

Just after Shepard, Garrus and Miranda defeated the human-reaper larva the floating platforms around them started to collapse, throwing the team around - and unconscious.

Minutes later, Shepard finally regained conscious. "Shepard!" it came from Garrus who just freed himself from some debris. And then Shepard turned around to look for Miranda and found her...

"Miranda!" he called out as he saw her laying still unconscious on the floor. But even worse, a part of the platform was lodged in her rib cage, blood literally littering the place.
Immediately he knelled down and checked for a pulse. And found nothing.
"Miranda..." tears filled his eyes.

"Do you copy? Commander? Come on, Shepard, don't leave me hanging. Do you copy?" Jokers voice suddenly filled his ear piece. Next his gaze went up and met Garrus'.

"I'm here, Joker. The ground team...". "All survivors on board. We're just waiting on you.". Now Shepard just looked at Garrus. "We gotta go, Shepard...". "I know!" the commander said as he looked one final time at Miranda. No, his love. "Goodbye, Miranda!".

And just then, the end run began. Since the team planted demolition charges which would soon flood the Collector Base with a deadly radiation spike, they had to hurry.
Almost instantly Collector Troops were chasing them, followed by the disembodied voice of a certain entity called Harbinger.

"Human, you've changed nothing. Your species has the attention of those infinitely your greater.". Oh, not this again! Shepard cursed silently.
"That which you know as Reapers are your salvation through destruction. You will surrender your potential against the growing void. We return, and you will rise!" the booming voice of Harbinger commanded.

Just when Garrus and Shepard were close to a turn a gray-colored Collector variant they'd never seen before suddenly jumped out of cover, only armed with an assault rifle. Only to be consequently dispatched by a precise headshot aimed from Garrus' Chakram Launcher.

"Nice shot!". "Be glad this thing had no shields!" Garrus deadpanned as they continued their escape, the turian leading their escape.

Finally, they came across another set of floating platforms hacked by EDI which led directly to the Normandy SR-2.

Just then, the door of the ship opened and Joker and Legion appeared, giving them fire support.

Garrus was able to cross them when suddenly another piece of debris came falling down - and hit the platform in the middle, cutting of the escape route for Shepard who was behind.

Immediately the commander improvised and decided to take a running jump into the Normandy's airlock - and succeeded in doing so!
As he was hanging on the airlock floor, he almost lost the last bits of strength when Garrus and Legion pulled him up.

"Not loosing you too, Shep!" Garrus whispered as the airlock doors closed. Next, the doors closed and the Normandy SR-2 made a dashing escape.
Just in time, because ten seconds later the radiation surge hit.

***

When Shepard entered the communication rooms he willed himself back to the here and now. "EDI, patch me through!" he commanded. "As you wish, Shepard. Patching you through to...".

Just a little over two days ago, he had finished his physical therapy from the transfer, and had finally made his way onto the Citadel. When he found out that Dr. Eva Core had failed and that Shepard was on his way here, time was of the essence. "This body is so uncomfortable, I can't stand it." He was currently walking down one of the hallways in the Presidium Commons, after purchasing some hardware for his 'Camera-bot', when in reality it was to his new robotic form. By doing this, he would be able to increase his capacity and be able to plant a virus into the Normandy itself and be able to leak information from it to his top scientists at Cerberus. And if he was lucky, he would maybe be able to take over EDI and have her work for him again. But that was a long shot. He had just entered an elev ator to go to the Normandys' docking bay, when a random human male ran up to him yelling
"Hey, Ms. Allers!" he shouted "I'm a HUGE fan of your show and would be honored to get your autograph!"
"Umm, sure" The Illusive Man said, unsure of what to do. But suddenly, he remembered a feature of this new suits programs with his brain. He accessed her memories and went on a form of autopilot. "Sure, I always love meeting one of my fans." He said perfectly, "Who should I make it out to?"
"My names Conrad. Conrad Verner." The fan said with a lot of eagerness.
"Well, here you go Conrad. I hope you have a nice day." The Illusive Man said with a smile. After the boy left that smile instantly left. "Ugh, what an annoying little brat. But at leadt I had a way to effectively test my autopilot feature, which was a huge success" And with that, the elevator reached his floor.

14522111.content:
"Approaching Mass Relay in 5, 4, 3, 2, 1..." Joker's voice hailed through the Normandy's cockpit as the SR-2 came closer to the mass relay leading to the centre of galactic civilization.

Just then a blue ray of light whisked the ship away, only to cause it to rematerialize more than 10.000 light years away in the Widow System.
The mood aboard the small frigate was dim. Not longer than a week ago the crew lost a former member and brother in arms in the war against the Reapers, Dr. Mordin Solus.

"Alright ladies and gentlemen, ETA to the Citadel in 14 minutes!" the handicapped pilot continued. "Commander, I just received a message on the QEC. It requires biometric identification for playback!" the voice of Specialist Traynor came from the cockpit speakers.
"Joker, tell me when we're cleared to dock!" Commander Shepard said and walked the short way to the Combat Information Centre.

"What you got?" he asked Traynor. "It's a heavily encrypted video file. Initial analysis leads me to the assumption that it comes from an STG Operative. I forwarded it to your private terminal!". Traynor replied in her thick british accent.
"Thanks! And Traynor... good work!" the Commander acknowledged and took the elevator to his quarters.

Once there, he activated his private terminal. "You've got 1 unread message. Starting playback." the computer's voice read.
"Asked friends in STG to relay this to the Normandy once it enters Widow System. Greetings Shepard!" none other than the voice of Mordin Solus chimed. "Mordin!" Shepard brought out in disbelief.
"Saw me burn on Shroud Facility on Tuchanka. Probably assume imminent death. Wrong assumption. Survived, heavily wounded, but alive. Had to disappear! Indoctrinated agents in STG, very dangerous, posed threat to continued physical integrity. Will make this quick, am going to use Adjutant Virus you brought from Omega to go into hiding. Will meet at supplied coordinates. Don't want to confuse, but am going to look slightly different. Will see you there. Solus out.".

Now all Shepard could do for the next few minutes was just to stare at the terminal. Mordin is alive...
Just then another realization struck! "What did he say about the Adjutant Virus!? Oh damned, if this is going to turn into another invaded space station...".

***

10 minutes later the Normandy was approaching Docking Bay D-24. "Normandy, you're cleared to dock. Do you need transport?" the Alliance Docking Officer hailed them.
