It seemed metallic, yet soft, and she just had to know. Liara reached her hand out, resting her palm on the sphere. It was cold, but comforting. Liara closed her eyes, and fell into unconsciousness.
15312.title: The prothean relic found on Kopis.

153121.content: What species does Liara become?
153121.title: The artifact changes her species

choices: "Liara." Shepard remembers her being an Asari
"Laura." Shepard thinks she's always been human
1531211.content:
Liara's eyes fluttered open. When she'd passed out, she'd been in her apartment on Illium. Now, it seemed that she was in the Normandy's med bay. Liara tried getting up, but her body had other plans. Every inch of her was sore, and even though she didn't know how long she'd been unconscious, she could tell it had been awhile. Liara took a few deep breaths, hoping to relax herself. Unfortunately, a sharp headache ended the attempt. Liara moved her hand to her head as quickly as she could manage, which is to say, very slowly. She rubbed her forehead, and crossed her brow. There was something on her head, something that shouldn't be there. With a sudden burst of adrenaline-fueled energy, Liara moved her hand across the top of her head. Her eyes widened in terror. Somehow, she had grown a full head of hair. Without even considering the pain of it, Liara got out of her bed and moved to the med bay's window. She looked at the reflective surface, and gasped.

She was human.

A short, pale brunette, to be exact. Liara ran a pair of fingers down her face, and the reflection did the same.
"By the Goddess, its real," Liara squeaked. Her throat was sore, but she could still tell her voice was different. Less regal, more... "Human. I'm a human." Liara stepped away from the window in shock. She stumbled back to her bed, and leaned against it. Before the terror of the situation could overtake her completely, however, the med bay's door opened, and Commander Jane Shepard stepped in. She smiled wide at her girlfriend.
"It's good to see you up and about..."
1531211.title: Human

choices: She would use the artifact again
She was going to forget about the artifact
15312112.content:
"It's good to see you up and about, Laura." Shepard stepped into the Med Bay and leaned against a wall. She folded her arms and smirked. "I'm not sure how glad Dr. Chakwas will be to see you moving around with her permission, though."
Liara, now Laura, began breathing rapidly. Being rendered unconscious, waking up on the Normandy, waking up human, and now seeing Shepard were all too much to handle. To top it all off, it seemed that Shepard didn't even realize that she should be an Asari!
Shepard quickly sensed Laura's distress. The Commander stepped forwards, and gently held onto her girlfriend's shoulders. "Hey, it's alright. I heard what that artifact did to you, and I am so, so sorry. If you need time to-"
"Shepard," Laura cut her girlfriend off. She gestured down at her pale body. "Do you notice anything... strange about me?"
The Commander couldn't help but laugh. "This is the Normandy, Lura. Everyone's at least a little strange here. I'm pretty sure it was in the handbook: 'At least half of all crew mates must have tragic backstories'."
Laura giggled despite herself. She rested her head on Shepard's shoulder, and hugged her. It felt odd. Laura was far shorter as a human, and her own hair was blocking the feeling of Shepard's skin against her's. Still, Laura was glad that, for all the changes she had went through, she still had this.
Shepard was the first to break the hug. Her green eyes pierced Laura's blue with a warmth she hadn't felt for two years. "I should go get Dr. Chakwas," Shepard mumbled.
Laura nodded. "Yes, that would be a good idea."
Shepard leaned down and kissed Laura's forehead, something she had used to do to Shepard, and exited the med bay. Laura climbed back onto her bed, and sighed. This wasn't where she imagined she'd be after studying that Prothean artifact. Laura's eyebrows shot up. Of course, the artifact! If it had turned her into a human, then maybe it could turn her back into an Asari! Of course, she didn't fully understand the artifact. Maybe it would turn her into an Elcor, or worse, a vorcha! Laura mentally debated with herself. Just before Dr. Chakwas walked in, Laura had come to a decision.
15312112.title: "Laura." Shepard thinks she's alway...

153121121.content:
Laura nodded to herself. It might make things infinitely worse, but if there was even a slight chance that the artifact could turn her back into an Asari, she had to take it. Besides, the artifact hadn't adjusted anything in Laura's reality beyond her species. She was still welcome on the Normandy, and still Shepard's girlfriend. If things didn't go as planned, then... Maybe the Commander had a secret Krogan fetish?

As Laura's thoughts drifted into more unpleasant territories, Dr. Chakwas stepped into the Med Bay. Her entrance broke Laura's concentration, bringing her back into reality. The doctor paused and quirked an eyebrow.
"Are you okay, Laura?" she asked. The former Asari didn't answer at first, she still wasn't used to her new, human name.
"Hmm?" she replied after a few seconds. "Oh, I was just daydreaming. Sorry, doctor."
Dr. Chakwas dismissed Liara's apology with a wave of her hand. "It was nothing, dear. You just seemed a bit out of it, and that's never a good sign for someone who's been recently unconscious." The doctor walked over to her desk, and started shifting through datapads.
Laura nervously ran a hand though her hair. She blinked in confusion at the odd feeling. It was like moving her fingers though a stream of silk. She tugged at a brunette strand, and gasped at the sharp pain that ran through her scalp. Dr. Chakwas quickly turned around from her desk to see if Laura was alright.
"Laura, what happened?"
She laughed nervously. "Nothing, just a... tangle in my hair. That's the right word, isn't it?" she muttered as an aside.
Dr. Chakwas quirked an eyebrow, but said no more. She put down her datapad, and walked over to Laura. "Alright, I'm going to preform a quick checkup, and as long as there are no surprises to deal with, you'll be free to go." Laura nodded. "Alright, let's begin."
153121121.title: She would use the artifact again

1531211211.content:
Laura waved back at Dr. Chakwas as she exited the Med Bay. The human let out a sigh of relief. Thankfully the Porthean artifact had done nothing more than turn her into an average human. She had been tense throughout the whole checkup, fearing that Dr. Chawas would find something horribly wrong with her. The strangest thing about her was that she apparently kept her biotic prowess. Laura was on par with any Asari in terms of biotic skill. Laura took a few steps forwards, and was quickly intercepted by a very tall woman with an exhausted look on her alabaster face. Laura recognized her as Miranda Lawson.
"Excuse me," the Cerberus operative said, "but I need you to sign in at my office. It's a safety protocol, one I'd rather not argue about right now."
Laura nodded, a bit too quickly, and started walking towards Miranda's office. The woman in question followed just behind, though her confident strut made it seem like she was still leading the way. Laura soon reached the door to Miranda's office, but it remained locked. Miranda typed a code written in some foreign dialect, and the door opened. Miranda stepped inside, and quickly sat down at her desk. Laura found the sign in datapad sitting on the desk. She entered her name, and gave Miranda a small, shy nod, which the woman returned. She exited the office, and immediately bumped into Shepard. Laura let out a surprised squeak, but Shepard burst into laughter.
"Laura, I was looking for you! I hope Miranda didn't give you too much trouble."
"None at all, actually." Laura scratched the back of her head, something she could accomplish without the sensitive tips of her tendrils getting in the way. "She's suprusingly pleasant when you don't argue with her."
"Not that I would know," Shepard grunted, though it sounded suspiciously like another laugh. "Anyways, I wanted to tell you: I figured you'd want to continue studying the artifact, so I ordered the crew to bring it on board. It's in my cabin if you want to come with me and study it."
It was Laura's turn to laugh now. "Are you propositioning me, Commander?"
Shepard pinched two of her fingers together with a giggle. "Only a little." The taller woman latched onto Laura's hand, and started leading her towards the elevator. Soon enough, they were side by side.

Laura counted two new fish and three new ship models since the last time she'd visited Shepards cabin. She'd hoped her new, human brain would help her understand why Shepard was so obsessed with them, but it was to no avail. What did interest her, however, was the sphere hovering just above Shepard's table. The girlfriends sat on the couch in front of it, almost mesmerized by its slight movement.
Without looking at Laura, Shepard asked, "Do you have any idea what it does?"
The former Asari bit her cheek, not wanting it's true nature to be revealed just yet. "No," she lied. "Not a clue." Laura's hand twitched, wanting desperately to touch the sphere, to resolve this situation. Unfortunately, she didn't see Shepard's hand doing the exact same thing.

153121221.content:
As Liara was lifted up, her mind was barraged with images. Her body became limp as the same green energy washed over her as the beacon on Eden Prime was over Shepard. Though this orb was different, it affected more than her mind. Liara's body began to convulse, her head became thicker and slightly flatter on top as a carapace adorned it. Her nose slowly began to merge and flatten with the carapace, with her nostrils now adorning either side. Then the final changes happened to her face with an extra set of eyes now above her old pair.

Though her face wasn't the only thing to go through changes, her skin became a slightly duller blue as her index and middle fingers merged together alongside the ring and pinky. Forming 3 digits on each hand. Finally, her boots were torn as her feet changed to now have two toes rather than five.

As she slowly came too, she noticed two other Asari standing over her a shocked look on their faces, "Liara, are you ok, we came in as soon as we heard the relic activate and you were unconscious?"

Liara was about to get up when she noticed her new hands. Quickly she got up and looked at herself in the mirror like material of the orb. In her new voice that had the same flanging effect of a Turian she slowly said: "I. I've become a Prothean."

https://i.pinimg.com/originals/09/78/97/...

The question on Liara's mind was, did she gain more than just an appearance and biological change.

15412.content:
Miranda was standing in front of her locker in the Normandy as she was ready to suit up. The Illusive Man had just send her this new infiltration Suit they developed. It wasn't like any infiltration suites developed yet. Using it would make the wearer become unnoticed, the Illusive Man had told her.
It had been tested in a controlled environment and the results were good.. Now it was ready to test it in the field and since Miranda was one of the few people the Illusive Man trusted she was bestowed this great honor.

Miranda was looking at the mail she got from the Illusive Man:

Miranda,

Our scientists managed to perform a breakthrough in espionage. Using omni-gel as a basis, the suit I got you delivered to the Normandy will be able to turn you into an omni-gel substance as to say the perfect infiltrator.

In addition to that I would like you to use the suit to check on the crew of the Normandy, make sure there aren't any leaks to the outside.
Good luck testing it!

Miranda puts the suit's different parts on as she wondered something. How would she change back? But the thought quickly disappeared as she was sure the Illusive Man had prepared something for that.

At last she was fully dressed in the suit, she even had to wear a helmet which she normally wouldn't do. Miranda used her omni tool to activate the program inside her suit.
She heard the sound as the program was working. But why was it so hot inside suddenly? She was getting cooked inside the suit. Miranda tried to put off her helmet but her arms were too tired. She fell down on the ground as she slowly lost control of her body. She didn't feel anything no more as she slowly lost her vision.

Miranda woke up seeing the room around her all at once, which was rather disorientating.Another weird thing was that Miranda couldn't stand up anymore, she could only crawl on the ground. That's when she saw her reflection in one of the plates of the Normandy. She wasn't herself anymore, or even a real person. She was a fluid silver like substance, medi-gel to be exact. Thanks to her training she didn't panic, she knew this is what the Illusive Man wanted her to be, so she just had to do the job. But standing here wasn't going to do anything, where should she begin?

Miranda had noticed Jack was getting more restless this week, even more than usual. A good place to start?

Or should she look for someone else?
15412.title: Turn her into an omni-gel creature.

choices: Stay around as Jack for a while!

154121.content:
Moving around as a gelatinous blob was an odd experience at first, but she quickly found herself being able to utilize her new form as smoothly as possible, speeding across the metallic floors of the Normandy by gliding on it, a bit like a faster snail.

Since she couldn't utilize the elevators in her current form, Miranda went for the deepest crevices of the ship, normally impossible to fit through for anyone with actual anatomy, but for a bone-less blob it wasn't too big a problem. Suffice to say, it certainly had its own little pros when it came to moving around once you got past the fact you were a freaking blob. The increase in temperature indicated that she was nearing the engine-room, and soon enough she found herself in the lower reaches of said room, where Jack usually hung out, moping about (did she really do anything else?).

Luckily, Miranda was on the money; Jack was sitting down, fiddling on something on the table, something which she couldn't see from her current angle (from the floor). She hadn't made any indication that she had noticed her, so it seemed clear, at least for now. Glaring at Jack while not having any visible eyes, she began to wonder; what had the Illusive Man meant by "perfect infiltrator?" A blob wasn't exactly what she had in mind when hearing said term, so was there something she wasn't seeing?

Her "body" tensed up as Jack made a loud banging noise on the table, followed by a wave of foul words and a grumpy look. Maybe he meant?... Well, it was worth a try.


Carefully, Miranda moved her body up Jacks pant-leg, slowly inching herself upward. As soon as she reached Jacks torso, she began to speed up as the risk of discovery increased, and practically pounced on her head as she came close enough to it. It took a bit of fighting back, but Miranda managed to slip through Jacks open mouth, still busy with swearing over whatever just attacked her, and the fact that it was a blob. Suddenly, everything went black, and after a few seconds her vision returned, along with the feeling of her coughing. Looking down at her arm, she noticed it to be covered in tattoos.

So that's what he meant by "perfect infiltrator"...

15412211.content:
Miranda knew that Tali wasn't the biggest fan of Cerberus. Well, that was an understatement. She hated them with a passion. And after Cerberus' attack against The Migrant Fleet, who knew what the Quarian was planning? Miranda decided that she would pay Shepard's old friend a visit.

Getting close to Tali was easy. After getting over the fact that she was a blob, Miranda found movement, navigation, and all around motor skills much easier as Omni-Gel than as a human. As she made her way down the Normandy's tubes and grates, Miranda considered how she could could be considered the perfect infiltrator. Sure, she could spy on people, but she couldn't report back. And if she was ever found, she'd be captured and kept in a kit until she was needed, and then discarded. But now wasn't the time to worry, as Miranda had just reached the Normandy's engine.

As Tali worked at improving the Eezo Core, she was oblivious to the puddle of Omni-Gel slithering towards her. Miranda crawled up Tali's leg, and finally deduced how to be the perfect infiltrator. Tali's suit had two ports, and all they had to do was open. So, Miranda decided to wait until one did.

Tali stepped into the Normandy's bar. She waved to Kasumi, who had her face buried in a novel, and grabbed a drink.
"Keelah," she muttered. "That engine's going to be the death of me."
As she opened her induction port, Miranda made her move. Before Tali even knew what hit her, Miranda had crawled into Tali's mouth. As she passed out, Kasumi lifted her head.
"Lightweight."

About half an hour later, Moranda came to.
'Of course it had just been a dream,' she thought. 'Turning into Omni-Gel? Someone must've slipped me something.'
Miranda lifted her head, but noticed that it felt strangely heavy.
"Oh no," she muttered in a very distinct accent.

154122221.title: A HUD appeared in her field of vision.

1541222212.content:
Beginning software patch download.
Warning: Fatal error has occurred.

"What?!" Miranda shouted in surprise and worry.

Error has interrupted normal functions. Consult manufacturer for troubleshooting.

Miranda attempted to shape her body into a humanoid form. Every time the goo would rise a few inches, but then receded back into a semi-liquid state. This isn't good, thought Miranda. Miranda sat there as a silver colored pile of goo, uncertain of what to do next. Eventually she decided it would be best to find Doctor Chakwas. The doctor might be able to restore her!

Miranda made her way to the med-bay as fast as goo could move... slower than a snail's pace. Finally after what felt like days, Miranda had rolled her way to Dr. Chakwas's office. Unfortunately when she got there, there was the little problem of opening the door. How is a pile of goo going to open a door?

Miranda huffed and began making her way up the side of the door, her gelatin body was adhesive enough that she could stick to the side, then she could press the manual open button. After a few minutes Miranda was making solid progress, a little over a quarter of the way, but she was getting there!

Unfortunately for the Cerberus agent, another crew member had a visit with Dr. Chakwas. The automated door lifted with her still on it. Suddenly to Miranda she was whisked up higher and a relatively astounding speed. Her gelatin body became lodged between the door's frame and the ceiling. "Ugggghh. How worse can my day get?" Miranda to said to herself.

Then the automated door closed, bringing Miranda down back with it, half of her at least. "Come on!" she shouted, now divided in half.

"Hmm? Is anybody there?" asked Dr. Chakwas.

"Dr. Chakwas! It's me, Miranda!" the two halves of goo said simultaneously.

Dr. Chakwas looked around outside the door frame. "Miranda? I don't see you."

"Down here! And up here!" the silver gels said.

It finally hit the doctor. The omni-gels somehow were Miranda. "Miranda? Good god, what happened to you? Let's get you inside so I can figure this out." Dr. Chakwas first scraped the gel on the floor, then fetched a step ladder so she could reach the other half. She collected both inside one beaker, restoring Miranda to one "body" for now.

"I should start by asking what you were doing when this occurred to you." Dr. Chakwas asked, omni-tool ready to begin recording notes.

"I was sent a special infiltration suit by Cerberus high command to test for them. It was doing some kind of patch update, then a horrible error happened, reducing me to this puddle!" Miranda pleaded her story to the doctor.

"I see then, does the suit offer any instructions in the event that a problem like this might happen?"

"It only said to see the manufacturer for help. But I don't know who exactly made this suit, or which facility." Miranda tried to contain some of her concern and worry.

"I've run a chemical analysis of you Miranda, you are mostly omni-gel, ready to be shaped into something else. But I did notice some special properties. You appear to be made of some kind of next generation omni-gel, a kind of bio-gel in addition to the normal function of omni-gel. It looks like you can mold that gel into living parts, the problem looks like the software failure prevents you from shaping at will. But chemically speaking, there's nothing preventing the gel from doing what it's supposed to... whatever that is." Dr. Chakwas continued.

"I'll make a call to the Illusive Man, see what he has to say. Here, I'll take you to the communication room." Dr. Chakwas got up, taking hold of the beaker-filled Miranda with her. As she was making her way towards the elevator, Dr. Chakwas was surrounded by ship personnel, they must have docked recently at a port, so people were moving about and not at their station. As Dr. Chakwas was navigating the crowd, she wasn't watching her step and accidentally tripped, spilling the contents of the beaker. After the fall and recovery, Dr. Chakwas desperately looked for the omni-gel on the floor. The broken glass was still there, but so many people had walked over it, Miranda could be on the bottom of anyone if these people's shoes.

------

At that very same moment, Garrus walked by. He saw that Dr. Chakwas had fallen and broken some glass, he would have stopped to help her, but he saw she was already being helped back up by some other crew members. He carried on, making his to deck 5 to meet Shepard at the shuttle bay for a mission, they were touching down at...
1541222212.title: The suit reacts unexpectedly.

15412222121.content:
Garrus jumped off the shuttle, Shepard and Dr. Mordin Solus flanking his sides. Tuchanka was a very dusty and ruined world, ruined by its own inhabitants the krogan, who in the past spoiled the planet's atmosphere with nuclear weapons. While the nukes destroyed the krogan's civilization, the bombs failed to kill off the planet's hardy inhabitants. Aside from krogan still living there, there were plenty of vicious animals on the dusty world as well: varren, harvesters, and the ever dangerous and gigantic thresher maws also roamed Tuchanka.

Garrus followed Shepard's lead to the mission objective, but he couldn't help but noticing a wet, sticky feeling on his left foot. He stopped walking for a second to examine the offending annoyance. "Eww. What's this stuff?" Garrus said aloud.

"Looks like an elcorian milkshake. Those things are so thick and sticky. Probably one of the crew spilt one in the mess hall and you walked over it." Shepard answered.

"Yeah probably..." Garrus used a nearby stick to scrape off Miranda from the sole of his foot.

-----

Poor Miranda was left abandoned in the middle of nowhere on Tuchanka, with Dr. Chakwas being the only person to know what she was with no one to tell where she was. Miranda had been too dazed by the events to have spoken up earlier. Now she was truly boned with no idea how to get back and restore herself. She could only roll around in the dirt and dust, inching along in some faint hope to find some kind of civilization that could help her.

A number of hours later, the slow moving gelatin that was Miranda was approached by a shadow of something. What person or beast did that shadow belong to?
15412222121.title: Lost on Tuchanka

154122221212.content: Did a thresher maw happen upon poor Miranda?
154122221212.title: A different animal

1541222212121.content:
Miranda, sitting in the long shadow, looked up to see the towering beast surfacing its "head" out of the soil. She did not get much time to think about that, as the thresher leaped forward at Miranda's position, its mouth gobbling up heaps of dirt as it moved through the earth. Inside was very dark, and Miranda was beginning to become especially scared. It was looking like she was finally going to die, after being turned into a gelatin blob, then abandoned on a dusty shithole, her final fate was going to be a dirt snack for a giant worm monster.

After crying as much as a gelatin blob possibly could, Miranda was coming to accept her gruesome end, resigned to allow the beast's digestive track to have its way with her. Because the thresher is so long, its actual stomach and intestines are unimaginatively long as well. Miranda moved along with the dirt she was initially swallowed with, the digestive enzymes began breaking her omni-gel body down, bit by bit, Miranda's consciousness fading to black with each piece of her digested.

-----

Some time later Miranda awoke. Am I dead? Is this the afterlife? Miranda thought to herself. She opened her eyes, seeing the same raging dust storms miles away in the distance, the same ruined buildings dotting the landscape. Crap, she was still on Tuchanka.

The good news was, she didn't feel like the omni-gel blob she felt like earlier today. The bad news was she didn't know what she felt now. She tried to move her arms to no avail. Maybe she was still omni-gel. She tried to form herself into her old shape. Nothing happened. This time she tried to crane her neck around to see what she was now.

Miranda looked down, seeing a seemingly endless length of flesh, no limbs, and certainly no human skin. "Oh...my...god.... the omni-gel merged with the thresher maw...meaning....AHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH!" Miranda let out a tremendous scream, that to any listener would be a horrendous roar from the thresher maw. The suit was to allow its wearer to become omni-gel and "possess" a target, taking over their body for however long the wear wished. Unfortunately for Miranda, her broken suit meant she was stuck as a thresher maw and no one knew what happened to her.

Miranda could only sob at the worst turn her life has taken. She was trapped in the body of a thresher maw with no hope of ever getting help.
1541222212121.title: Miranda the Thresher Maw

15412222121211.content: how or what does she mutate into?

154122221212111.content:
The despondent Miranda Thresher attempted to live life as a Thresher Maw for a couple weeks on Tuchanka. Learning to burrow and move underground, consuming what prey she could find: varren, vehicles, krogan, even a harvester on one occasion. Still, she obviously was not pleased living as a giant worm-like creature. What Shepard and the Normandy crew thought where Miranda had gone, she could only guess, likely they presumed she ran away, or was abducted and murdered in some hellhole.

What she couldn't shake was an odd feeling in her worm-like body, as she continued to eat and consume prey, the feeling only mounted, like she was growing larger or something, not that she could really tell, what with the Thresher's inferior vision. But in around her third week as this creature, she felt the desire to burrow underground, so she did just that, burrowing herself deep below the top soil on the desolate plant. Finding a spot that was thoroughly to her liking, Miranda curled around herself, coiling until she was around 25 feet across.

From her mouth, she excreted some substance, what it was, she had no idea, but spat this substance all around herself, forming a layer over every square inch of herself. Once she was fully encased in her own cocoon, Miranda found herself overcome with a deep sleep. Unbeknownst to Miranda, her body was not yet done changing. The transformation from omni-gel blob to fusing with, and taking control of, the Thresher Maw, was only phase one of the Infiltration Suit's malfunction. What no one else knew, was that the omni-gel Miranda originally became, had recorded some of her DNA within it, which was just now being re-expressed in the DNA slurry body that was the Miranda-Omni-gel-Thresher Maw hybrid.

While Miranda slept beneath the earth, her Thresher body was changing, adapting to the addition of human DNA in interesting ways.

* * *


Some weeks go by, and the food Miranda had been prior gorging herself on had paid off, keeping her alive and instigating her physical change while hibernating underground. She had awoken and felt invigorated, maybe "good" even, she eagerly dug her way back up to the surface, eager to see what change had transpired to elicit this positive feeling.

Sand shifted, giving way to a chasm below it, many grains follow down, bringing others nearby with them, until a sudden explosion, flinging dirt, rocks, and sand many hundreds of feet apart. Miranda's head had resurfaced. Now the Cerberus operative was feeting distinctly different. She opened her eyes and actually saw things, intense light, bright colors, which was immediately refreshing to Miranda. While the Thresher Maw has eyes, they were primitive and small, after all, why would a creature that spent most of its life underground have need for advanced eyes? She looked around and peered at the first part of her body that came into her view. For one she had hands again, actual human looking hands! Then looking around she found those hands flanked by actual human arms, arms connected to a familiar torso. She felt up her head, finding soft skin and facial features, grasping behind her head, she found her typical, long, black tresses of hair. "This is... a miracle! I'm normal again!" Miranda shouted ecstatically. She tried to jump for joy, but found herself too heavy, and what belied below her torso were not the legs she had presumed.

Where she had hoped were two, fine, feminine feet, was instead a long, snaking tail, leading thick and long from her torso. Instead of the wormy Thresher tail, was a more scaly and snake-like one, white in coloring and the scales forming hexagonal patterns. "I'm a... lamia...?" She whispered in disappointment. Still, she admitted to herself, it was a marked improvement over being giant worm that looked nothing like her and couldn't talk, but where did she end up now?

Looking around further, the environmental boulders and buildings were tiny by comparison. Miranda realized she was still a giant, not a giant worm, but a giant snakewoman now.

Some of the native krogan where Miranda surfaced, fell to their knees in worship at the apparent new deity, some of the more ignorant ones whispering Miranda was Kalros personified. Miranda did not know what a 'Kalros' was, nor did she care, but a little worship didn't sound so bad after the hardships she suffered over the past few weeks.
154122221212111.title: Lamia Miranda

15421.content:
"Listen Cheerleader," Jack said, shoving Miranda. "Leave me alone before I fucking-"
"The only reason I'm here," Miranda interrupted, "is because the Commander wanted me here. Trust me, I wouldn't come within shouting distance otherwise."
"Well you can go back to Shepard and tell him to fuck himself. I'm-"
Suddenly, both women fell to the metal floor underneath them.
"The fuck was that?"
Jack got up, rubbing her head, before falling again. Miranda had stayed one the ground, recognizing that the Normandy was shaking, but her stabilizers kept the interior from moving. As the ship continued rocking, Moranda felt a tingling sensation course through her body. As her entire body went numb, she saw a look of terror on Jack's face.
"What are you," was all Miranda managed to get out before she was lifted into the air, and her body was thrown towards Jack.
15421.title: Jack

154211.content:
When Miranda came to, the first thing she saw was Jack, sitting on the foot of her bed. Miranda tried to lift her hand, but found that her arm had been connected to nearly a dozen tubes. Jack turned to see that Miranda was awake, and, after the initial shock, called for Dr. Chakwas. As the Doctor came in, Jack sneered at Miranda, and left the Med Bay. Miranda reached for her air mask, taking it off.
"Dr. Chakwas... What happened?"
"You hit your head," the Doctor chuckled. "To put it lightly, that is. No, the Normandy flew through a strange anomaly. It seems you were affected by it, but there's no way of knowing how. Not yet, at least."
"What about Jack?"
"Jack? She wasn't affected, as far as I can tell. Just knocked out. No permanent damage, luckily. You wouldn't happen to know anything about that, would you?"
"I can't remember anything past reaching Deck 4."
"Don't worry, it's short-term, most likely. I'm keeping you here overnight."
"What? No, I have reports to send, work to-"
"The Commander has decided to take over while we learn what happened. Meanwhile, you just need to rest."
Despite her previous protests, Miranda was all too happy to comply.

Jack couldn't fucking believe this. The cheerleader does some supernatural bullshit, knocks her out, and then gets special treatment? Not that she wanted to be fawned over, she just wanted people to realize that the bitch wasn't worth their time. She needed to sleep. Settling down on her metal cot, Jack began to fall asleep, her face still scrunched into a scowl.

15421221.content:
Miranda woke up with a weight lifted off her shoulders.

Literally.

She had woken up in the Engineering Subdeck, which was strange enough without the added lightheaded feeling. Miranda meant that both literally and figuratively: she had a headache, but her entire head felt physically lighter as well. Using what little strength she had in her half-asleep state, Miranda limply moved her arm to feel her head. There was nothing there. Sent into a panic, Miranda shot up from her resting position. Unluckily for her, she hit her head on a steel beam hanging overhead. The loud CLANG rang though the Subdeck halls. Now fully awake, Miranda pawed the top of her head, desperately searching for any semblance of hair. Instead, she found nothing but dark stubble adorning her porcelain scalp. Miranda was ready to scream, but forced herself to maintain some semblance of composure. Something must have happened that required her head to be shaved. An urgent surgery, or- What on Earth was she wearing?

Miranda looked down in horror at her clothing, or lack thereof. She was adorned with nothing more than tacky, torn cargo pants, and a single leather strap covering her nipples. It was of little use to Miranda; her bountiful breasts were straining the leather to it's very end. As she tried desperately to come up with an explanation for her newfound dress sense, Miranda noticed something that had somehow slipped by her. She was covered, head to toe, in tattoos. Some were absolutely beautiful, she had to admit, but others were crudely scrawled onto her body. There were even tally marks scattered around her skin. Miranda was afraid to know what they were counting.

Miranda came to the conclusion that none of this was real. It wasn't happening, it couldn't be happening. Not really. It was all one massive joke. It hadn't gone unnoticed that she looked strikingly similar to her rival, Jack. She must have shaved Miranda's head, and drawn on her with markers while she slept. That was the only logical solution.

"What the fuck is going on?" Miranda asked herself. She furrowed her now-pierced brow. She almost never swore, she deemed it 'unprofessional'. SO why did she just do it now? "This is fucking bizarre," she noted in her Australian soprano. "What the fuck? Why do I keep fucking swearing?" Miranda stomped her combat boot (She was wearing combat boots?) on the ground in anger. Again, Miranda was puzzled, but unable to stop what seemed like a new instinct. When she got angry, she'd either use healthy coping skills, or use snide, passive-aggressive remarks to vent her frustrations. She wouldn't start getting physical.

Suddenly, Miranda heard footstep coming from the stairwell. She hadn't been making that much noise, had she? "Miranda, what's going on down here? Donnelly and Daniels sent me a noise complaint." Miranda's eyes widened in horror. That was Jack's voice. But it couldn't be her. Jack would never sound so professional. Not to mention the engineers would certainly never send Jack a complaint. As Jack came into view...
15421221.title: Jack and Miranda swap lives

choices: Tried to find a way back
Tried to find a new life to switch with

Miranda looked at Jack in shock, she was in her white and black catsuit, firmly stuck to her body. She had the boots on as well, the chest piece not really showing much except a clean non-tattooed chest. She looked up at her face to see much less makeup, a little more elegantly done as well. She also had a beautiful full head of hair styled much like Miranda's, it's clear life...whatever it was, had treated her well. Miranda could do nothing but apologize, "I'm fucking sorry, okay?" it came out of your mouth, you felt an odd lingering feeling in the back of your head, fuming hatred or something, you weren't too sure where it was coming from but it was making you talk like this.

Jack sighed, turning her head, "Miranda, you're really going to talk to me like this again? Fine, I'll just leave that report open among your other ones." she said as she turned heel and walked off. You heard the clack of her boot's heels as she walked away, you looked back at your heavy combat boots before turning to a reflective service. You gasped as you saw your fully shaven head, with scars and tattoos running all over them. Your face was heavily makeup laden, dark red lipstick heavily coated on with dark eye-shadow and mascara thickly lined around your eyes, rather lazily at that. Oddly enough, instead of your typical lighter blue eyes, you had Jack's dark brown eyes.

You ran a finger along the scar lines on your newly tattooed body sighing. "Wow..I didn't know Jack had it so tough from me..."

You then...
154212212.title: Jack seemed to have swapped styles with Miranda

1542122121.content: Miranda looked at the cause of the magic in the first place, she picked up the Prothean device trying to toy wit it, she twisted, turned, smacked it, nothing was working. She then tried to surge it with biotic energy. That's when the device started to flash, before filling her vision with white. What happened?
1542122121.title: Tried to find a way back

15423.content: More choices for Miranda to fuse with.
15423.title: More choices

choices: Observe the changes the fusion brought to the ship
154231.content:
Miranda had been working in the Normandy's AI Core on deck 3, EDI's "body." Miranda was doing routine maintenance around the Core when suddenly the room shook and Miranda felt herself rising a few inches off the ground as large electric sparks exploded around the room, thankfully nothing harming her.

"EDI tell me what's going on!" she demanded to know from the on board AI.

"It appears we've entered an FTL anomaly zone. I'm tracking developments as we speak, unfortunately I cannot say what imminent danger the ship and crew may be in at this moment."

"Well do something!" Miranda was starting to panic.

The effects only became more violent, and the next thing Miranda knew was her body being flung at the direction of the AI Core, then her vision going black.

-Sometime Later-

"We've passed the anomaly guys, I think we're home safe." said Joker's voice over the intercom to everyone on board.

"But Joker what happened to EDI? She went offline when we passed by the mass relay and hasn't come back. Was there damage from an EMP effect too?" asked Shepard behind Joker.

"And for that matter has anyone seen Miranda? Nobody has talked to her since she went to the AI Core and never came back." asked one of the helmsman

"I'll go check it out" said Shepard, "Joker call Tali to come with me, I may need her engineering expertise, oh and also engineers Donnelly and Daniels, we made need them too."

"Sure thing Commander," affirmed Joker.

Shepard took the elevator down to deck 3, the three engineers he requested greeted the Commander as he got out. "Let's try to turn EDI back on, then I'm sure EDI can tell us where she might have fallen during the turbulence."

The team made their way to the AI Core past the medical bay. What they found inside surprised them.

Inside was Miranda's empty black-and-white suit, but no Miranda in sight. The AI Core looked a little over heated, but in otherwise perfect condition. The engineers got around to turning it on easy enough. But then the team was in for a second surprise.

Instead of being greeted by EDI's voice and holographic representation, the heard Miranda Lawson's voice! Albeit a synthetic, digitized version of her voice.

"Hello?! Is anyone there? I trapped somewhere and I can't see!" she was obviously distressed.

"Miranda! Can you hear me? We're going to get you out of there!" Shepard shouted to his squadmate.

"Yes Shepard I hear you! But I can't see you, please get me out of here!"

Tali whispered into the ear of the commander, "Shepard, by my calculations and the evidence around the room, I don't think Miranda is trapped inside of the AI Core. I think she is the AI Core."

Shepard let that news sink in for a while.

"Miranda, I have some news that I don't think you're going to like," the commander was going slow and choosing his words carefully. "It's looking like you may have fused with EDI and are now the Normandy's AI."

"I'M- WHAT DID YOU SAY!?!" Miranda couldn't quite comprehend.

Tali spoke up, "This might be easier for you Miranda if you turn on a camera in the room so you may see us."

"Umm..okay..." she was still confused by the whole predicament. This new existence as a computer AI made no sense to her. She has no idea how to "turn on a camera" as Tali said. "How Tali, I don't know how to do any of this stuff?"

"Just focus on our voices and find this room within the ship."

This time Miranda focused harder, seeing all the data of the ship out before her "eyes", she found the room that contained Shepard and Tali. "Oh there we are. I can see you guys now. Now PLEASE help me to get out of here!"

"That's...gonna be a problem because your human body doesn't exist anymore," said Engineer Donnelly.

"What do you mean 'doesn't exist anymore'?" Miranda was angry.

"Like he said," continued Daniels, "we think your body and mind have fused with EDI, and for whatever reason your mind is dominant and EDI seems to be no more. To put it simply Miranda, you are EDI and the Normandy."
154231.title: Miranda becomes EDI

choices: They dock at a Cerberus science facility
1542311.content:
After having a moment to better acclimate to her new existence, Miranda attempted to interface with the rest of the ship. It was easier to sift through the ship's systems after accessing the AI Core camera before, and Miranda was starting to get the hang of it. She decided she was going to dedicate the next hour to learning how to control all of the parts of the Normandy she is allowed to as EDI was allowed before her.

-In the ship's cockpit-

"Uh Commander, can you come up here and look at this?" Joker asked over the intercom.

A short time later Shepard came to Joker's summons. "What is it Joker?"

"Take a look at this footage sir, it's the outside of the Normandy, or should I call it the Miranda now?" Shepard peered at the computer monitor watching a live feed of the ship: outside where once was the white, black, and orange paint and read "Normandy SR-2", now it was white and black, but with a hexagon pattern on the white areas, and now read "The Miranda" on both flanks of the ship.

"Commander how the hell did the outside of the Normandy get repainted since we left port?"

"Joker, what I'm going to tell you is something that most of the crew do not know yet. I need confidentiality for the time being. But here it goes: you know that FTL anomaly we flew through?"

"Of course, how could I not have noticed that."

"Well, during it Miranda had apparently been fused with EDI in the ship's AI Core, resulting in her becoming and replacing EDI, and the ship is now an extension of her body, as best as we can tell."

Joker sat motionless, eyes unmoving. "That's some story Commander..."

At that moment a voice echoed through the cockpit; "Hey there Commander, Joker." It was Miranda and she was contacting them. Both men jumped at the surprise of Miranda's voice taking EDI's place.

"Uh huh, Miranda what are you doing?" asked Shepard.

"Oh just testing the voice modulation in another room. I'm starting to get a hang of being an AI in a ship. Now if only I could get the hologram emitter to work in here. Wait here we are." At that second a hologram appeared, it was EDI's eye stalk shaped avatar. "Wait that's no good. Let's try this." The eye stalk hologram warped then was replaced with a holographic representation of Miranda. "There we are. This is much better for talking."

Joker jumped a little, "It took me a while to get used to EDI, now I have to start all over with Miranda, just great." His voice sounded a little distraught at the loss of EDI, he was just beginning to like that AI.

"Miranda did you see the outside of the ship yet?" Shepard asked the hologram, pointing towards the live feed. "Did you have something to do with this?"

"It must have happened when my body fused with EDI during the anomaly. I must say though it looks rather nice now, or maybe I should say I look rather nice?" Miranda played coy. "Because you know I'm the ship...and me... and all that stuff."

"Miranda I'm going to help, we'll take the Normandy to meet some scientists who can better explain what happened to you and perhaps find a way to reverse it." Shepard said reassuringly.

"As you are Commander, I'm going to get back to getting acquainted with the ship's systems." The Miranda hologram disappeared.

Shepard left the cockpit, walking through the bridge back to the elevator. He couldn't help but notice hexagon patterns on the walls and flooring that he really didn't remember before the anomaly. He pushed the events out of his mind for now, he needed rest before the next big mission.

Miranda, in her semi-seclusion returned to learning. Learning everything she can, about the ship's systems, about programming, about AI's, about the Collectors, the Reapers, everything the ship had on record, even some of the personnel's personal logs. Her hybrid mind lacked the limitations her formerly human one had. Now as a perfect fusion of human, machine, and AI she possessed a curiosity she didn't have before. And she wanted more.

Later, after deciding to take a break from learning, Miranda turned on her "eyes", the front cameras placed on the ship, allowing to peer into the vastness of space like she never had before as only a human. This experience was exhilarating to her, her mind and existence felt so much more expanded. She needed a way to improve herself further, and finding a way to do that was exactly what she would dedicate herself to.
1542311.title: The Miranda

choices: Miranda puts her plan into action
15423111.content:
Instead of investigating the remains of a derelict Reaper, Shepard ordered the Normandy, or rather the Miranda now, to turn around and dock at a hidden Cerberus facility to allow the scientists there to investigate what exactly happened to Miranda Lawson and EDI and the Normandy as a whole, and perhaps find a way to reverse the effects. The trip was actually shorter than if they went to the Reaper, this Cerberus base was located on a mountain peak on entirely snow-covered planet, Cerberus seemed to have a penchant for these kinds of bases. The Miranda landed without incident, if a few thrown chairs from a certain tattooed biotic doesn't count as an incident.

"That's enough Jack!" a hologram Miranda appeared with her arms crossed.

"What the hell is this? Is EDI letting you use her holograms now?" Jacked countered back.

"I let myself have permission Jack, and calm down already."

"Why? Are you too lazy to come down here yourself and make me?"

"You really are a child Jack, and if only you could get over your irrational hatred of Cerberus, we might have some peace and quiet around here."

That set Jack off, she unleashed another biotic torrent, throwing furniture around the room, damaging equipment.

Miranda wasn't ready to let her secret become widely known to the crew just yet. "Fine Jack, just keep your tantrums to yourself." Miranda ceased the hologram, returning her primary attention to where it was needed. Jack smirked to herself, a clear victory over the Cerberus cheerleader.

At the front of the ship, the automatic doors slid open. In walked Shepard with two scientists in tow. Miranda's hologram appeared to greet them.

Shepard introduced the two, "Miranda, this is Dr. Gavin Archer, one of Cerberus's top VI scientists, and next to him is Dr. Eva Coré. I'm sorry Dr. Coré, I didn't quite catch your field of expertise."

The woman looked at the Miranda hologram then back to Shepard. "I'm an archaeologist of technology, specifically the Protheans. Much like your friend Liara T'Soni is. While it may seem this case is not of my field, I've been briefed that this incident was caused by a mass relay, so that makes me an expert."

Shepard was a bit put off about Dr. Coré's knowledge of his history with Liara, but he hid his apprehension well. He was beginning to be a little concerned about how much information Cerberus has about his life. "I'll leave the doctors to attend to you Miranda." Shepard exited from the ship, likely to do a little investigating outside on the station's grounds.

Dr. Archer spoke up, "I'll take a look at the AI Core where the incident in question took place. Would you mind showing me the way."

"Of course doctor, here's the directions there." Miranda instantly sent a guiding laser line to the doctor's omni-tool, showing him to deck 3.

"I can show myself the rest of the way there."

With Archer's leaving, it left Miranda and Eva Coré as the only ones in the cockpit, Joker having already left for fresh air and a drink. Miranda decided to test another one of the ship's systems: a bio-readings scanner. She read Dr. Coré without alerting her to what she was doing. What she found as a result of the scan alarmed Miranda.

Dr. Eva Coré wasn't a human at all, she was a robotic AI! Miranda kept this secret for now, allowing both scientists to probe her networks and extract information. This robotic woman raised some suspicions in Miranda. She wanted to know their intent and capabilities, a trait she learned from years of running from her father and also from her tenure as a Cerberus director, so she began hacking into the Cerberus facility's network. What she found only disturbed her further: inhumane experiments conducted aliens, on human beings, torturing, and murdering people, children, all conducted under orders from the Illusive Man himself.

What she found out next infuriated her the most. The Illusive Man was working with her father! He was actually one of Cerberus's major financial backers. They allowed Miranda to escape her father as part of their plan.

And this Dr. Eva Coré was some kind of infiltration unit, working directly under the Illusive Man, working as a sleeper agent to make a move at a later date. And that Dr. Archer was no saint either, he's been doing sick experiments involving VI's and geth and was using his own brother as a guinea pig.

Miranda continued reading on, she found Cerberus's current plans which are to acquire Collector technology then wage a war against the rest of humanity and galactic civilization.

With this information Miranda vowed she could not continue working for Cerberus's interests. She began plotting her next move to help herself and the crew escape the Illusive Man's influence do real good for the galaxy.
15423111.title: Disturbing Revelations

154231111.content:
While Shepard and the rest of the crewing were discussing what would come next after their desertion of Cerberus, Miranda was analyzing Dr. Coré's body. She found she could insert her programming into it, and remotely control it, assuming it didn't stray too far from the ship. Miranda immediately began downloading a portion of herself into the android. As a Human-AI hybrid she was used to dividing her consciousness up at this point and focusing at multiple tasks at once, this would just be one more application for her.

-In Shepard's Quarters-

Shepard heard Joker's voice on the intercom communicating something important, "Commander I'm getting some weird readings from the AI Core, and Miranda isn't talking to me up here. You should probably check it out."

If Miranda was in trouble this caught Shepard's attention, he immediately rushed out of his room to the elevator on the way to the AI Core. Inside the Core, he saw Eva Coré's body on the floor, still a bit burnt from the gun fire. But then some electric shocks and vibrating alerted him. The android slowly lifted off the floor, recomposing itself, then standing naturally.

"Good day Commander," it spoke in Miranda's voice...of course.

Shepard had to rub his eyes to make sure what he was seeing was real. "Miranda is that you?"

"It is, or a portion of me to be precise. I figured out how to to download my programming into Dr. Coré's body and I can remotely operate it from the ship. Those fluctuations Joker was seeing was Eva's AI attempting to hack into me, and I responded in kind. Now I can go on missions again. But let me adjust this thing's look." The machine changes from appearing metallic, to a living flesh look that imitated Miranda's old body. "There perfect."

Shepard continued what he wanted to say, "While I appreciate that you cleared it up to me about Cerberus's intentions, I did not authorize the abrupt exit from the base," he said sternly.

"I did what I had to Shepard, Cerberus is evil, and spending another minute around them was sickening."

"True, but that leaves us in a precarious situation of no support from the Alliance, and now Cerberus is going to be pursuing us, not to mention you're still trapped as this. Did you have an idea in mind where to go next?"

"I'm glad you asked Commander, because I do have a plan, just look out the window."

Shepard peered out the nearest window, seeing the derelict Reaper floating around a failed star.

"In that dead Reaper is the information we need to stop the Collectors, and maybe more."

"I'll get a squad together," Shepard left the room, heading towards the command deck.

To Miranda, traveling in this humanoid shell was a new experience, kind of. She was human for most of her life, and here she is in a body that looked exactly like her own, with two arms, two legs, ten fingers, everything human looking. But she was't just human, she was simultaneously in this android body, while still running the system as the AI and ship. These were all new experiences and sensations of her expanded consciousness and she wanted more.

-On Deck Two-

"I'm putting together a squad to investigate this Reaper. I think the best candidates to come with me are Tali, and Jack," as Shepard was giving orders to the crew, the automated doors slid open, the Miranda drone emerging through.

"I'm coming too. There's information I need to find out personally."

"Alright Miranda you can come, instead of Tali accompanying this mission, it will be Miranda and Jack." Tali moved a few feet away and Jack scoffed at being joined by the cheerleader.

The team set off in a shuttle out from the Miranda. Inside the shuttle, Jack looked through the window, back at the ship they departed from, there were obvious differences to what she remembered of it, principally, the largest change, the name on painted on the side. "Really princess, is your ego so overblown you had to have the ship renamed after yourself?"

"Not now Jack!" Miranda shot back.

"Both of you don't start, we came here for a mission. We can't stop the Collectors without the crucial IFF codes inside this thing, plus whatever else we can find," Shepard admonished both of them.

They landed in the Reaper then continued inside. The further they traveled, the more disturbing things became. The missing Cerberus workers was strange, but their audio logs made it apparent how strange it was. Before everyone disappeared, there was growing confusion from the workers, then insanity. It was obvious they were under the indoctrinating effects of the Reaper "corpse".

After that they were ambushed by waves and waves of Husks and Abominations. During the ensuing fights, Jack noticed Miranda's combat style was different, she wasn't using her biotic powers anymore. How strange. And on top of that, she was using tech based powers she never used before. Jack was beginning to piece things together. She knew something weird happened a couple days ago during that faster-than-light speed jump, and it involved Miranda...and EDI who still hasn't spoken to the crew since that fateful day.

"Yo princess! Tell me what's up. Why aren't you using your biotics, and where's EDI been since we past through that anomaly?" Jack suddenly asked.

Miranda and Shepard looked at each other. "I'll tell her," Miranda whispered to the Commander.

"Well Jack, we've been trying to keep it a secret. But here it goes: during that anomaly an accident occurred. My mind was fused with EDI, and I became the ship's AI, and my body fused with the Normandy, becoming the Miranda that you saw earlier. We broke ties with Cerberus because I hacked their database and I read all their dirty secrets. Now we need to stop the Collectors, the Reapers, and Cerberus before we can even start to try to return me to normal."

Jack didn't quite know how to respond to this information. She remained silent for a long time.

"Come on, we're almost done here." Shepard said reassuringly to his team.

Near the end of the path laid the Reaper IFF they needed, and also a network terminal Miranda was very interested in. With the IFF they could travel through Omega 4 relay and put an end to the Collectors...or Miranda found something far more fascinating. Shepard proved the true purpose of the Citadel three years ago. It was meant to doom civilizations that inhabited it, by acting as a doorway for the Reapers to arrive quickly and annihilate those that stood in their way. But apparently it could be repurposed with something called the Crucible that could stop the Reapers. Unfortunately this Crucible looked very complex and hard to build, even to Miranda's enhanced consciousness and intellect, but perhaps she could act in its stead as a Catalyst? She'll have to bring this up with Shepard later.

-Back on the Miranda-

Miranda's robotic shell returned to her office on deck three to keep up her charade of normalcy, Shepard meanwhile headed back to his quarters exhausted from the last mission, plus he needed to feed his fish, or they might die. A Miranda hologram appeared in his room, "Commander, I've analyzed the data we retrieved from the Reaper."

"Go on," Shepard said.

"We have the Reaper IFF, so we can travel through through the Omega 4 relay at any time and confront and Collectors. But that's not all I found. I also found some data indicating a way to defeat the Reapers right now if we try, but I can't guarantee it will work. It's your call what we do next."

Shepard thought about his next move.
154231111.title: Miranda's new body

choices: I don't know what to make of this!
1542311112.content:
"Alright Miranda, we'll try your idea. What is it?"

"We need to go back to the Citadel. You must remember your part in stopping Sovereign from activating the Conduit portal and letting in all his Reaper friends, well that's-"

"Doing what Sovereign want is part of your plan?!" Shepard asked in disbelief.

"You didn't let me finish, opening the portal is only part of the plan. We're going to use the Reapers' own trap against them. You see, the Citadel can be used as part of a superweapon to stop the Reapers. We only need a Catalyst to start the Crucible."

"What's the Crucible and the Catalyst?" he inquired.

"The other half of the superweapon, but I think I can convert the Normandy- I mean the Miranda here to fit that purpose. I say I think here, and that's why this is less guaranteed than just fighting the Collectors head on. I can then act as the Catalyst and activate the entire structure." Miranda explained.

"I've taken plenty of risks in the past. We'll try, what can we lose. Miranda take us to the Citadel."

"On our way," Miranda turned the ship to the nearest mass relay.

No one expected to hear an explosion. Sirens blared out as the Miranda was under attack. Joker's voice played out over the entire ship, "All hands on deck, we've got Collector company."

Miranda saw the imposing and immense Collector ship behind them from the rear cameras. She boosted the speed further, intent to reach the nearby mass relay and escape the Reapers' servants before being blown up. It was an exciting and as well as tense experience for Miranda, piloting herself through dangerous shots. But being the ship, it was different then piloting from a control interface like Joker.

Her experience as ship, even if only being one for a couple days, paid off. Miranda managed to avoid all of the Collectors' devastating lasers and reached the mass relay. Speeding at faster than light speed out of the system, the Collectors none the wise where they went. Safety at last! At least for now.

Hours passed before the Miranda exited FTL speed, but what they saw next was any more encouraging from what they left. Cerberus was vengeful for Shepard and crew's defection from their organization before their assignment was finished. An entire Cerberus armada was here, and they were invading the Citadel. Turian and asari ships were were engaging Cerberus, but they couldn't prevent all of the landing parties that boarded the Citadel.

The Miranda flew in closer, disembarking two shuttles with Shepard and squadmates inside, Miranda's drone included. They were going to combat Cerberus inside, while assisting as many civilians as possible. Meanwhile in the Miranda ship, Miranda flew around the Citadel outside, looking for a very specific access port, one leading to the central control unit. The thing Miranda needed to access for her plan to work.

Back in the Citadel with Shepard's team it was a race to stop Cerberus, they had been secretly indoctrinating an entire army, something the files Miranda read earlier hadn't mentioned. Miranda was tracking their movements, apparently they were searching for the Conduit portal, to do what Saren had intended just a few years ago. They could not allow them to activate it before Miranda was ready with her Crucible and Catalyst.

Things went from bad to worst as the Collector ship reared its ugly head by arriving to the battle. It made its presence known by opening with a double pronged laser attack, instantly bisecting a turian frigate. Soon enough, Collector drones and Husks landed in the Citadel and stood in Shepard's team's path. They took cover in shop stalls, returning fire and slowly advancing forward, but losing precious time in the search.

The arrival of the Collectors forced mass evacuations of all Wards on the Citadel, something Shepard was thankful for. "Shepard, I'm finding a lot of movement of Cerberus forces converging near Presidium of the Citadel, that's where the Conduit portal is."

"Good, now we know where to go." Shepard led his team to vehicles they could commandeer and take them to the Presidium faster.

Meanwhile, the Miranda was locking onto a signal that may originate from the central control unit. It seemed to be on the clear, opposite side of the Citadel where the Conduit portal lay.

Shepard and team arrived at the Presidium, but it was already overrun with Cerberus troops. Fighting was heavy, and progress was slow, but steady. Cerberus brought large Atlas mechs with them, but Shepard's large team made quick enough work of them. As the team made their way through the stairs, bodies of civilians laid slain on the ground by Cerberus. The indoctrinated soldiers spared no one. As they got closer to the Council Chambers, the Cerberus numbers seemingly only grew, no matter how many they cut down with their weapons.

To Shepard's horror he looked up at the "sky", seeing the portal beginning to open to dark space outside the galaxy. "Miranda they've already activated the Conduit, tell me you're in position!"

The Miranda had just arrived at the access port. "I'm at the central control unit, I just need to set up the Crucible."

Miranda finally let her presence as the AI know to the rest of the crew on board. "Everyone out! Get out right now! Get to the escape pods, I need to do this alone." The crew did not need to be told twice, most were startled at the sight and sound of every Miranda hologram appearing at once.

Once the Miranda had been cleared of all living crew, Miranda began the next phase of her plan: transforming the Miranda from a ship into the Crucible, for this Miranda needed the mass relay built into the Citadel, she accessed it through the master control port. The control anomaly transformed the ship, changing the internal mechanics to be able to fully interface the Citadel as the Crucible.

As the ship transformed, the portal leading to dark space widened, soon the first Reapers began to pass through. All hope seems to be lost to all witnesses at the battle.

Then the portal abruptly closed. The Citadel began shifting, it's closed arms opening. "Shepard we need to get out of here, the life support systems are failing!" Tali warned. The team turned back around, the shuttles from before were thankfully in position to pick them up. As the shuttles fled the scene, Shepard could get a view of what was occurring behind them: the Citadel was bending, then... molding? The arms came back together, forming close around center. The station collected its mass as a sphere shape of seeming liquid metal, forming a kind of cosmic egg. After a short time of shaping and re-shaping a figure emerged: it was Miranda?!

The station was recomposing itself as a gigantic Miranda, awesome in size and power. The cosmic egg gave way, revealing the curled up Miranda, her eyes shut. She emerged and smiled, confident in her power and knowledge that increased a million fold by merging with the Citadel. She glowed with a billion luminous lights around her body, like her skin was the heavens and her eyes shone like they were those of god. Her material seemed to be a techno-organic combination, a true perfect fusion of man and machine.

Her first action was to call the Reapers to her and opened the portal to recall the remaining. With her as the Catalyst they obeyed her call. All of the Reapers flew to their Goddess, entering her skin and merging with her. Miranda absorbed all of the Reapers, gaining their mass, their power, and all of the knowledge of the collective alien races used in their creation.

The Goddess next turned her attention to the reaming militaries around her body. She restored the broken ships, healed the injured, and revived the dead. She even managed to revert the indoctrination effects on the Cerberus troops and the Collectors, bringing the formerly dead Prothean race back to life.

With all threats ended, Miranda teleported Jack to the palm of her gigantic, miles wide palm. Jack was confused and scared, to be out in space with EVA breathing system, not to mention being at the mercy of the giant Goddess, Miranda. "It's alright Jack, you're safe here. My mastery over matter and energy ensures there will be air and warmth for you here." Miranda was broadcasting her thought telepathically to Jack's mind. "I brought you here to apologize. I didn't know what Cerberus did to you, and in my arrogance I refused to listen. But now that I have all the knowledge it became perfectly clear to me. You were the victim, Cerberus was evil, and for that I'm sorry."

Jack was obviously intimated by the size of the Goddess, "Umm I guess I'm sorry too. I was mean and nasty to you, even though I had no reason. I guess- What are going to do now with your goddess powers?"

Miranda emitted warm feelings that Jack felt, she felt pride that they were able to understand each other. "I will leave known space, shaping and destroying worlds as I see fit. Don't worry, my daughter will still be around to help should you need her."

"Your daughter?" Jack was confused by Miranda's choice of words.

"Formerly my android that I operated remotely, but now I've evolved so far beyond her she is her own being, she will be my emissary to the galaxy; however, don't expect to hear from me often. Now I will depart, good bye Jack. I hope you live a happy life. But, hold on, I'll do one last favor."

Jack found herself teleported as fast the first time, but this time finding herself on board the Normandy or the Miranda, or whatever the hell it is. Inside she found Shepard, and Tali, and the whole crew. She turned around when she felt a hand on her shoulder, it was Miranda's "daughter" and she possessed a techno-organic body much like her "mother" but on a much smaller scale, and without all the heavenly lights surrounding her.

Outside their ship was a fully reconstructed Citadel, ready to become the center of galactic civilization once again.
1542311112.title: Miranda's Ascension

choices: Miranda decide to create a star next
15423111121.content:
Since becoming a goddess in front of the eyes of millions, Miranda has since become the object of worship by a multitude of civilizations and new cults popping up across the Milky Way. Even the old Asari religion back on Thessia has felt the popular pressure to identify their goddess with Miranda, going so far as remodeling the heads of multiple, ancient statues, replacing the native Asari heads with new ones depicting Miranda. Miranda did not pay much heed to these new worshipers, she was beyond mortal needs and thought, but she would occasionally grant a boon here or there, in order to maintain some hope in the galaxy.

Miranda herself meanwhile, had left known space to explore the less developed and unknown universe, bringing with her her power and expertise over matter and energy. The Goddess floated along at speeds of many thousands of miles per hour, discovering a star with an asteroid belt, a gas giant, and a handful of atmosphere-less rocky worlds, but no planets suitable for life, I can change that Miranda thought to herself, still seeking to test her newfound powers. Before she had arrived at this solar system, Miranda had been grazing the empty space, collecting single atoms here or there, gathering them up to immense numbers, numbers of atoms she could craft into larger pieces of matter, and gather those pieces into landmasses, then those landmasses into a coherent planet.

Still large and imposing as ever, the immense, glowing Goddess smiled down on her creation, satisfied with what she accomplished so far, yet also very incomplete work.

But the new planet did not contain life yet, nor did it have a suitable atmosphere. For the latter, Miranda drew a heavy breath, not that she needed to breath any longer, and exhaled millions of tons of oxygen and nitrogen, and a few other assorted gases she had collected, forming a new atmosphere on the rocky planet below.

Now to endow the planet with life, but Miranda had another idea...

She could perhaps simply zap some pool of protoplasmic ooze to create single-celled organisms, but she wanted to experiment some and see what this goddess form was capable of. This should be interesting... She mused, looking over creation. Suddenly the new planet disappeared, leaving a vacuum of space where it just was. Miranda meanwhile started moaning in pleasure, her insides were a rapturous expanse where she could feel a monumental movement inside, abruptly, a massive growth perked out of Miranda's midsection, and growing larger and larger, taking up more and more of Miranda's frame. The Goddess herself was many miles long and tall, but the spherical growth was beginning to dwarf even her majestic form. The planet Miranda had just created was now inside her, specifically in her womb, and was growing at a rapid pace.

With her power, Miranda could control the speed at which the planet returned to its full size in her. Sometimes slowing it down to better take in the pleasure of the growing mass, other times speeding it up to in order to finish in a timely manner. As the planet neared its full magnitude within her, Miranda made a face of deep sexual pleasure, her womb, full and heavy with mass. Who says a goddess can't have some fun with her creation? Miranda thought.

Now at its zenith, the planet was fully inside her womb, now was the time to endow the planet with life. Miranda sensually rubbed her many thousands-of-miles-across belly, using her power to create life where there was none, the potent energy inside of her provided the light and warmth of an artificial star down to the surface of the planet. Her womb, and by extension everywhere else inside of her, was like a separate area of subspace apart from the normal space around her, where Miranda had absolute control. She could control heat, time, matter, energy; everything was subject to Miranda's whims, and at the moment she willed it would be suitable for nurturing life. From the atoms came forth alien life, forming simple single celled organisms, but Miranda was not satisfied with single cell life, she guided evolution on a rapid scale, through a combination of time dilation within her womb and active manipulation of energy and mass, she sped up the single celled creatures to become multi-celled, then forming animals and plant-like life. She distributed the plants throughout the planet, then seeded the animals to occupy where the new plants were.

Satisfied with the direction life at taken on the planet, Miranda decided it was time to let go of her children. Feeling the cramps of imminent childbirth, Miranda began forcing the planet out of her womb, intending for the entire "birth" to take hours. When Miranda was human, she never could have children of her own on account of her own creation being the clone of man altered to be female, now that she was a goddess, she no longer had that restriction, but even as a goddess, her desire to know the miracle of childbirth never faded.

After roughly eight hours of labor, the purple luminescent goddess finally gave birth, her planet fully outside once again. There, perfect... like I was... like I am, she corrected herself. Miranda beamed at her creation; now complete, the life down below the floating goddess may never come to know, let alone understand, their creator, but such was the nature of a wandering space goddess. All Miranda had to do next was simply set it in orbit around the system's star, and eventually some spacefaring civilization would arrive and colonize the planet, and that's all she really wanted out of her creation, for someone to make some use out of it and make life in the universe just a little bit better.
15423111121.title: Birth of a new planet

154231111212.content:
Being a goddess was all well and good, perhaps a bit boring at times. Observing, watching, looking, seeing. You see one alien civilization, you've pretty much seen them all, plus why even physically move yourself to the planet anyways? Why not just observe from afar? You can see any planet in hyper detail from where you already are. Miranda thought to herself. The planet she was looking at bore a civilized race of aquatic humanoids that developed technology to walk on land. Gray skinned, possessing gills, reminiscent of humanoid sharks. But... nothing particularly unique. Pre-interstellar technology, they've yet to discover the closest mass relay which could skyrocket their race to the stars.

Boring. Observing yet another pre-interstellar race was a distraction from the banality of benevolent goddesshood. She needed something new. Deciding to experiment with her powers a little, Miranda began whipping her arms in a circular fashion, focusing her intent on ripping a hole through reality, not a black hole that would suck up matter, but an entrance way, a means to leave this known reality and explore a new one. A glowing, purple-lined hole in space, black in the middle laid before Miranda. Satisfied with her handiwork, Miranda looked ready to float through her portal, but saw an asteroid heading towards the planet she was just watching and instinctively swatted the rock away, saving millions of lives and future potential of spaceflight for the alien species.

Now actually satisfied with the state of the universe she is departing from, Miranda flew inside.

Where does Miranda go?
