15423112.content:
Walking into the Mess Hall, Shepard began to run his temples.
"Makes sense that I would get a headache."
The Commander went to talk with Mess Sergeant Gardner, but heard a small noise come from Miranda's quarters. Shepard furrowed his brows, and decided to investigate.

Within Miranda's quarters, a tall, slender woman with a pale complexion and tightly cropped bob sat at Miranda's desk. When Shepard walked in, she looked away from the computer terminal, at the Commander.
"Commander Shepard, it's good to see you," said the woman, who's voice was all too similar to the Normandy's former AI.
"Who are y- Wait, EDI?"
"Yes Commander, that would be me."
"Why are you here? How are you here?"
"I assume it has something to do with Operative Lawson's ascension to AI status, though I cannot be sure."
"Why didn't you try to find someone instead of... What are you doing?"
"I'm sorting Operative Lawson's old files. Also, I didn't report in as I experiencced no signs of panic."
"Still, it would've been nice to know."
"I will keep that in mind Commander. Would you like me to report in now?"
15423112.title: Shepard makes another startling discovery

choices: Miranda has other ideas about returning human
Over time, Miranda becomes more machine like, while EDI becomes more human
154231122.content:
Shepard stepped out of Miranda's office, mentally reeling from his encounter with apparently EDI. He stood in place trying to figure out the situation. He decided to bring the engineers back and Doctor Chakwas this time to help explain the situation. A few minutes later, Shepard had gathered Tali, Engineers Donnelly and Daniels, and Doctor Chakwas to join him at the Mess Hall outside of the office.

"Tali, Donnelly, Daniels, you three already know the sensitive information about what happened during the ships' last light speed jump. Dr. Chakwas, I need to tell you that a certain accident occurred to Miranda Lawson. Are you familiar with biological quantum entanglement?"

"I've heard of it in passing, but I've never encountered it personally in my professional career. Usually when it happens a person is entangled or fused with an inanimate object, sometimes the wall or floor and that's the end of the them. Is that what happened to Miss Lawson?"

"Miranda's case is one of the rarer ones, you see, we lost Miranda's physical body, only to find that she had become entangled with EDI's AI Core on the quantum level. It explains why no one has heard from EDI for several hours. We've had Miranda stay quiet so as not to alarm the crew, you're the sixth person to know what happened after myself, Tali, Donnelly, Daniels, and Joker. But I called you all here because I've found something just as strange, if not stranger."

"So what is it, Shepard? What's happened now?" Tali asked the Commander.

"It would be best if I just showed you all," Shepard's omni-tool activated, opening the office door. Inside was the same pale complexioned woman from earlier, still dutifully working at the computer terminal.

"Hello Commander, is there anything I can help you with?" she asked politely, in a somewhat robotic tone.

"I'll get right back to you in a moment, EDI."

"As you are, Commander." EDI affirmed, in the same polite tone; however, her voice lacked some of the finer nuance organic speakers talk with.

The group Shepard brought with could only stare slack jawed. Shepard closed the door to give them time to recover.

"I found her in here not too long ago, working as if everything were completely normal. What do you four make of it?"

"Well, I'd like to do a preliminary test to confirm what we're all thinking." Dr. Chakwas gave her impression.

Shepard led them back inside. Dr. Chakwas brought her tools in, ready to examine EDI's organic form. "Tell me EDI, what do you remember occurring at the time of the space anomaly?" Karin asked the now human AI.

"I remember monitoring the progress of Operative Lawson's maintenance in the ship's AI Core. As we entered into the anomaly, internal circuitry started to malfunction as some kind of irregular mass effect field affected Operative Lawson, bringing her into the AI Core proper on a subatomic level, but then... I'm sorry but I can't remember much else as my own systems began to fail around that time."

"This is very similar to Miranda's account," remarked Donnelly.

"And then what happened next?" asked Daniels.

"Well sometime later I awoke in Operative Lawson's office, now in this organic body, dressed like this," EDI motioned towards her outfit. It was a jumpsuit similar in design to the one Miranda once wore; however, this suit lacked the hexagonal pattern that was a signature feature of Miranda's jumpsuit, it was a completely smooth, featureless, white suit of some synthetic material. And instead of the black accents on the arms and legs, this suit's were blue.

Dr. Chakwas ran her tests, using some sophisticated tools, she was able to determine some if the history of the subatomic particles that now made up EDI's body. "From what I can tell, EDI here has a combination of particles from the Normandy's AI Core, a few from the hull, and a share of particles that originally made up... Miranda." Karin continued reading from her charts, "Furthermore, it looks like EDI inherited Miranda's biotic potential, so she should be one of the most powerful human biotics in the galaxy." EDI seemed to smirk a little at this revelation, but it was impossible for Shepard to ascertain.

Everyone in the room except EDI were startled to hear this revelation, but inside they knew this made sense. "I think what we can hypothesize from this, is that from that anomaly, Miranda and EDI somehow traded particles, and hence bodies and minds with each other. It's all very fascinating." Chakwas said.

A loud voice boomed over the intercom. "FASCINATING!? YOU CALL THIS FASCINATING!!!!????" An infuriated Miranda suddenly spoke up over the local intercom.

"Miranda please calm down, we don't want anyone else knowing what's going on." Shepard tried to defuse the situation.

"I'll tell everyone who I want to know, thank you very much! It's not exactly your secret to keep Shepard, you know?"

"Please Miranda, we're doing everything we can to help you. We'll get the best scientists to work on this and try to return your particles back to your body."

"...Okay, Shepard, I'm sorry. I lost it there for a moment, I just don't like people talking about my... condition behind my back." Miranda said apologetically.

"It's alright Miranda, I understand you're going through a tough time. In the short-term then, we'll divert course to the Citadel and find some physicists to help. In the meantime, EDI, you seem capable of carrying out Miss Lawson's duties until she can return to her post." The former AI nodded in a straight, robotic fashion. "And Miranda, I'm sure you're still getting acclimated to your place, everyone else back to your posts."

Miranda resumed her seclusion deep within the Miranda's systems, not closely monitoring any audio or video feed, but her slowly expanding consciousness kept one "eye" open at all time to them, just in case someone got to close to learning something they shouldn't. The Cerberus operative-turned-spaceship returned to learning all she could about technology from the ship's logs, what was intriguing her the most at the moment was the geth, she wanted more first hand experience with the enigmatic alien machines, but what concerned and worried her the most, were the nightmarish, and seeming invincible Reapers. The evil, immense, mechanical beings that threatened all civilization in the galaxy. Miranda determined to prevent this future she must use all resources available... including herself.
154231122.title: The Human EDI and the Watching Miranda

15423221.content:
Miranda had been working in the cargo hold on Deck 4 with Samara, moving boxes of extra Element Zero around for upgrades at a later time.

"And that's the last box of eezo to stack!" Miranda stated enthusiastically. "Thank you again Samara, you saved me a lot of time with these."

"It was my pleasure Miranda, I think we could learn a lot from one another." Samara smiled, stacking the last box of eezo.

"I thought so too, we should really go on a mission together some time."

Just then, a robotic, yet undeniably feminine voice, no doubt EDI's, rang out over the ship's intercom, "Warning: Approaching mass relay, prepare for FTL speed."

The next thing Miranda knew were the many boxes of eezo beginning to ominously glow. "Uhhh... Samara have you ever seen eezo react like this before?" Miranda asked the justicar a little nervously.

"Not in all my years have I ever witnessed Element Zero act like this. I really have no idea what is happening."

A few moments later the eezo cache reacted more violently, exploding out of its container, electrolyzing the air around the two, releasing incredible amounts of pent up energy. Soon, Miranda found an unseen force lifting her up, like she was being picked up by someone's biotic powers. "Samara, what are you doing!? Put me down now!" yelled the Cerberus lieutenant.

"This is not my doing Miranda..." Samara explained. "In fact, it's lifting me up too!" Samara was being levitated just as Miranda was.

"What's happening now?" questioned Miranda, now scared.

"I'm afraid to find out...."

The two trapped women suddenly found themselves drifting towards one another, as if gravity was pulling them towards the other. As the two midair women started moving, the speed at which they were soon going to collide increased further. The two finally touched in midair, above the stored shuttles in the cargo hold in a fantastic display of biotic colors, an explosion could be heard throughout the entire deck. A hovering blob of blue-purple biotic energy existed where Miranda and Samara had touched.

As the biotic smoke cleared, a single being dropped down from the air. What kind of person emerged?

Miranda decides she wants to recreate the anomaly (with another squadmate).
1542322121.content:
Miranda fell onto the floor with a hard thud, her biotic powers only slowed her fall by a tiny margin. She felt strange... like there was another force inside her mind vying for control of her body, but she quickly shrugged it off. Right now she felt sick, that eezo explosion was awful, it could have even killed her and Samara!

Wait.

Where was Samara?

Miranda got to her knees and looked around the shuttle bay, there was no sign of the blue skinned justicar. Maybe she got knocked back further in the cargo hold, Miranda thought.

Miranda straightened her hair, it was ruffled up severely by the explosion. Nearly dying was no excuse for bad hair, especially if she was going to be seeing people afterwords, which of course she would be on the Normandy. Her hands reached the back of her skull, but the odd sensation she felt immediately put her off.

There were these rigid cartilage like growths coming backwards from her scalp... almost like... an asari head crest!?

Miranda was deeply concerned now about what happened during the last FTL speed jump. What happened to Samara, and why does she have asari head tendrils?

Just then the elevator could be heard opening, out came Commander Shepard. "I heard an explosion, and came as fast as I could. Is everyone okay down here?" The Commander looked around the cargo hold, seeing some of the exploded crates that once held the unstable eezo. He saw Miranda on the floor, but she looked different to him.

"Miranda, are you alright? Where's Samara, I know she was down here too. Does she need help?"

Miranda looked up at Shepard. "I don't know where Samara is, but I feel sick."

Shepard could look upon the changes wrought on Ms. Lawson. Her hair was still intact, just now there were six cartilage tendrils extending backwards from her head, and her skin looked like it had a slightly bluer tint to it upon closer inspection.

"Hang on Miranda, we'll get you to Doctor Chakwas on the double." Shepard said reassuringly, leaning his ill squadmate up on his shoulder. "Someone come down to deck 4, Ms. Lawson needs medical attention now."

-------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ---------------------------------------------------


The next thing Miranda knew she woke up in the sanitary doctor's office of Karin Chakwas. Miranda opened her eyes, the light was intense, but at least the bedding was comfortable.

"Ah good, you've woken up," said the nurturing voice of the ship's resident physician.

"Where is... Samara?" Miranda asked, still in a daze.

"Uhhh about that...." Dr. Chakwas danced around the issue, trying to be as sensitive as possible, but also blunt. "While I've done some tests on you to search for the damage cause by that Element Zero explosion. I found some new strands of DNA that weren't there prior..." Dr. Chakwas paused. "....Well maybe I should just show you." She handed a mirror to the Cerberus agent.

What Miranda saw about nearly made her scream. She looked like she absorbed a part of Samara! Her skin was still mostly a pale white, but with an undeniable blue tinge to it. She still had her flowing black hair, but it was accompanied by the cartilage tendrils she remembered grasping before Shepard arrived. The tendrils were not exactly like normal asari tendrils, these ones were black and matched with Miranda's hair which still existed in long strands from the top of her head. Now their just existed noticeable cartilage "tentacles" coming from the direct back of her head.

"So tell me Karin. Where is Samara now?" Miranda wanted to know.

"We haven't found her. The working theory right now is that whatever that anomaly did, it caused you and Samara to fuse into one body with apparently you in full control."

Miranda didn't know what to think of this development. She was two people now? And a freak? Her emotions and feelings were confused further by the fact, that this body merging, in a perverse way, felt kind of good come to think of it. Like she had doubled her biotic powers, combing her own with Samara's. Right now though, Miranda wanted further answers on her condition.
1542322121.title: Miranda with a side of Samara

Miranda is persuaded to fuse with someone else
15423221212.content:
A few days later Miranda was deemed fit enough to go on missions, despite her current bizarre condition. She was assisting Shepard and Garrus on an assignment to wipe out some Blood Pack at a base they held on the sparsely populated planet, Zada Ban. The fight was going typically, Shepard and friends hid behind cover while taking shots at the enemy when the opportunity arose.

Shepard fired his assault rifle at an approaching vorcha, the vermin species lacked a shield, and despite its advanced health regenerating, it was no match for the Commander's torrent of sharply place shots. Garrus took the liberty of Shepard being the primary target, to use his sniper rifle to take out at long range an approaching krogan with a flamethrower. Meanwhile, Miranda was aching to test out her enhanced biotics, if she was going to be a freak, at least she was a freak with fringe benefits.

As the squad advanced through the facility, resistance became increasingly larger, more vorcha arrived in larger packs, followed closely behind by even more krogan handlers. Shepard activated his Adrenaline Rush, speeding up his rate of fire to a truly impressive level, cutting down several vorcha and injuring a couple of krogan. An enraged vorcha charged at Shepard from behind him, the Commander was too distracted be the enemies in front to notice. Garrus launched a Concussive Shot to knock back the enraged vorcha, then threw a Proximity Mine at the fallen vermin, finishing it off.

"Much obliged Garrus," Shepard complimented his friend.

"You owe me later for that one Shepard," the turian chuckled.

Miranda was taking pot shots here and there at enemies, awaiting for a perfect time to use her powers. She would not have to wait much longer.

Just then an enormous group of krogan came from around a corner. There had to be at least ten, very angry krogan, and they were clearly enraged and in a bloodlust state, so they would be all but impervious to crowd control abilities, almost impervious that is. Shepard and Garrus opened fire on the group of mad krogan, but in their enraged states, they felt little pain and continued forward onto the squad's position. Miranda scoffed, now she had her chance for a real challenge.

Shepard took cover behind a stack of crates, while these krogan were enraged some of them still held flamethrowers, and they could toast a human to death in a matter of two seconds of less. The Commander decided a shotgun would be best for this situation. The nearest krogan came around a corner, Shepard fired, it dealt a heavy blow, but still the krogan did not relent. Shepard fired again, and followed up with a bash from the butt of his shotgun. The krogan couldn't take that much punishment, falling to Shepard's follow-up attack. Just as Shepard returned to cover, another krogan came out of the woodwork, this time from the opposite side of the crates, and he was armed with a fist full of fire already in the process of blazing.

Shepard instinctively raised his arms to shield his face from the oncoming inferno. But a second later he felt no heat, no fire, not even warmth. He opened his eyes and saw in front of him Miranda. She had raised a biotic barrier that protected the two of them from the flamethrower's blaze.

"You really saved my ass Miranda!" Shepard yelled.

"I'm just getting started Shepard!" Miranda confidently said.

The Cerberus operative let leashed the barrier, directing its full force towards the krogan, knocking it over onto his back. Miranda followed up with a Slam, lifting the unprotected krogan into the air, then forcefully sending his body hard on the ground, finishing him off. Miranda breathed in heavily from her warm up. A couple more krogan came charging at the position, Miranda quickly performed a biotic Charge at one of them. The Charge briefly stunned the krogan, his partner moving in with a headbutt, Miranda countering with a Warp blast, causing a small biotic explosion in the area, damaging the two krogan. With their armor broken, the krogan were vulnerable to Lift and Throw, using the former on the first krogan and the latter on the second korgan collided them into each other, followed by another biotic explosion, killing both krogan.

The other krogan displayed rare tactical planning, instead of attacking one at a time or in pairs, the remaining seven or krogan all charged at once. One krogan landed a punch on Miranda, her barrier absorbing the impact, then a headbutt from another, Miranda was in real trouble. With her barrier depleting quickly, and now taking real damage Miranda fell to her knees, surrounded by multiple krogan all pounding on her at once.

Shepard and Garrus looked on in horror, seeing their squadmate being beaten horribly. The two began to take shots at the rabble, taking as many out as they could. Miranda at the center had enough, she unleashed a new power she never employed before: Reave. Miranda used Reave on the krogan clumped around her, all taking the effects of the biotic attack. Miranda got back to her feet, rejuvenated. One of the wonderful aspects of Reave is that it not only dealt damage to foes, it also healed the user. Miranda let loose a follow up Warp, detonating a massive biotic explosion, killing all the krogan who were previously attacking her.

Miranda stood triumphant around the circle of corpse surrounding her. Shepard and Garrus who stood by were impressed to say the least.

"Wow, Miranda you really did a number on them. That's some biotics you have there." Garrus remarked.

"They sure are, but could you expect any less from the perfect woman?" Miranda said with no little pride, crossing her arms and smirking.

"That was impressive Miranda, but where did you learn some of those biotic techniques?" Shepard inquired.

"Oh, like Reave? I don't know... I just did it...somehow."

"I know Samara could pull off that power. I bet you learned after fusing with her." Shepard reasoned.

"I think you're right."

Today, Miranda used a lot of biotic powers she could never use in the past, she gained Charge, Throw, Lift, and Reave, plus she created and held the strongest biotic barrier she ever made when she protected Shepard from the flamethrower. If I gained that much power from fusing with just Samara, imagine how powerful I'd be if I fused with even more biotics! Miranda thought privately to herself. To this end, she decided she should try this theory out, for the betterment of humanity, and for herself. For starters, that annoying and degenerate criminal, Jack hardly deserves her powers, maybe I should start with her first? Miranda wondered.

1542322121222221.content:
"But instead of Jack, I could... travel to Lesuss, an asari world which housed the reclusive Ardat-Yakshi Monastery, home to many of the asari's genetic aberrants, the Ardat-Yakshi. They're secluded from mainstream society for their lethal mating habits, no one would notice a few Ardat-Yakshis disappearing, nor would they care." Miranda talked to herself. "Wait, how do I know these things? I've never read about them on the Codex...wait... Samara!" The epiphany hit her. "These must be Samara's memories I'm recalling!

Miranda stroked some of her asari head tendrils, "Yet another gift left to me by her."

At the next shore leave at the Citadel, Miranda told Shepard she had some personal business to attend to alone, intentionally leaving out her excursion for more personal power. Determined to set out for Lesuss, Miranda suited up. Opting out of her typical white and black jumpsuit, she fitted in a customized version of Samara's justicar armor, after all, she did essentially inherit everything Samara owned, including her clothes. She personalized the armor by recoloring the red parts with white in her signature hexagon pattern. Then she hitched a ride on a commercial taxi to the secluded garden world of Lesuss.

On Lesuss, the monastery was impressive in size, characteristic of typical asari architecture, lots of organic shapes and curves built into the walls. Unlike most asari cities, the monastery itself was somewhat dreary looking, darker, and more ill-lit than most. Miranda could understand why Morinth did not want to stay here. Around, posted at every entrance and exit were asari guards, stationed here to ensure the Ardat-Yakshi secluded here, stayed here. Miranda smiled a crooked smile, just thinking about all the power she could have if she fused with all the asari who lived here.

Walking up to a pair of posted guards, Miranda brought with her the unstable eezo that caused the original fusion with Samara. "Hello, I was passing by and wondering if this was the Ardat-Yakshi Monastery?" Miranda asked ominously, her face obscured by the dusk shadow.

One of the guards responded, "It is, and unless you are a family member or are on official government business on behalf of the Asari Republics, I must ask you to leave."

"What if I said I did indeed have family here?" Miranda asked.

Eyeing her suspiciously, the cerulean skinned guard said, "What are you? You're mostly human looking, but you have asari body traits-" Before the guard could finish, Miranda sprang into action, blowing the unstable eezo powder she kept in her hand into the air. The air became heavy with eezo energy, catching the guards caught off 'guard', they coughed and could not react. Miranda activated her enhance biotic powers, attempting to imitate the other half of the fusion reaction, by acting as the Mass Effect Relay in the energy reaction. The air electrolyzed as had happened before with Samara. All three women, Miranda and both guards, were raised into the air ,"YES!" Miranda screamed in apparent victory.

"*cough* Huh? *cough*" one of the guards let out, wondering what was happening next. The three women suspended in air began to drift towards each other at increasing speeds.

"Here comes more perfection!" Miranda announced to her two new fusees. The three were speeding toward each other at the center point of where the previously stood. They collided midair in a biotic explosion, three bodies joining together into one. The new body descended toward the ground, the smoke clearing slowly. Stepping out from the explosion was Miranda, stronger than she was before, stronger this time that she did not pass out from the fusion process. Her appearance was largely unchanged, although her pale white skin with a blue tinge came out a little bluer than before. Mentally, she felt like she had four childhoods, four sets of parents, but Miranda was still dominant, she was the one in the driver's seat of this body, and if she didn't lose to a thousand year justicar, she wasn't about to lose it to some second rate asari guards.

Miranda activated some of her biotic powers, using Lift to effortlessly toss aside a twenty foot statue "So strong, so powerful. And there's so many more asari to join me." Miranda smiled in determination. Gathering more of her unstable eezo, Miranda made her way into the monastery, grabbing asari left and right, dragging them into private areas of the monastery, and working her "magic" dust on them, forcing them to join into a union with her body, whether they wanted to or not.
1542322121222221.title: The Ardat-Yakshi Monastery

choices: Cool, calculating Miranda keeps control, she fuses with them
Samara's maternal influence wins over, she spares them
15423221212222211.content:
After fusing with nearly every asari at the monastery, Miranda felt incredible to say the least, she felt god-like, she crackled with energy and walked with an aura of powerful biotics. Her skin has changed from a pale white to a deep Egyptian blue, now looking more asari then human. Miranda casually walked the halls, looking for more asari she could fuse with.

One asari who had been hiding behind a potted plant attempted to make a break for it after Miranda walked past her. Miranda heard her fast footsteps, turned around and smirked, yet another to join in her collective. She used Pull on the fleeing asari, whether she was Ardat-Yakshi, a guard, or some domestic worker mattered not to Miranda, she was just another source to fuel to growing power. Miranda levitated herself in the air, activating her fusion powers, her entire body glowed in a dark, opaque color, ready to absorb whatever lifeform that touched it next. The asari pulled in midair was met by the colliding Miranda, flying towards the asari. From her experience at fusing with people, Miranda had this down to a science. She could fuse with an unsuspecting person in a mere 4.73 seconds, ready to immediately fuse with another if she were in a group and some attempted to flee, she would already be prepared to drag them back to their inevitable fates.

"Ahhh so refreshing each time. Another boost to my powers, another set of memories, and all the knowledge and intelligence that comes with it." Miranda closed her eyes, feeling up her face, reeling at the ecstasy at her enhanced mind. At that same time, Miranda's moment of triumph was interrupted by some distant wailing. It was faint, but it meant people, and people meant witnesses... or more fusees, either way, they would have to be dealt with.

Miranda continued on, stalking the halls of the monastery. The wailing became louder, then quieter, as the wailing become sobbing. "Falere, we can't stay here any longer, that monster will find us if stay, and do to us what she did to the others." The sister Rila, tried to console her younger sister.

"B-b-ut she just-just... all of our friends." Falere entered into another sobbing state.

Miranda looked around the corner, her Samara parts identified them as Falere and Rila, Samara's daughters... Miranda smirked. Here was her chance to complete the family.

Once the pair of asari were ready to leave, Miranda made her presence known, stepping around the corner, blaring her biotic aura to make her entrance irresistible to look at. "You!" Falere yelled, pointing at Miranda.

"Yes, it's me, my name is Miranda Lawson. I've come to gather the power of the Ardat-Yakshi for the greater good."

"'For the greater good'? Absorbing, killing everyone here? That's your greater good?" Falere demanded to know angrily.

"The Ardat-Yakshi are social pariahs, I'm simply using their powers when the can't to combat the Collectors and Reapers. I've already joined with your mother, Samara. In fact, she was the first, setting me off on my mission to improve myself and help save the galaxy."

"Our... mother, is part of you...?" Rila let out, teary eyed.

"Indeed, and since she joined me, she's always wished that her dear daughters would join with us." Looking at both Rila and Falere, Miranda saw them both as beautiful women. It was too bad they were born Ardat-Yakshi, they're lives were condemned to be cooped up in this dreary monastery, at least by joining in her, they could see the outside galaxy. She pitied them, seeing them as if they were her own daughters, and in a way they were now, but she also desperately wanted to help them. Just then Miranda realized her Samara side was exerted itself in her psyche.

What side wins out?

Miranda lifted a stack of boxes in the Cargo Hold using her biotics. She moved them by Grunt, who had a pile of crates in his hands. The Krogan put the boxes down next to Miranda's, and clapped his hands together.
"Thanks for the help, those things were starting to bother me," muttered Grunt.
"It was my pleasure. We need more supplies in storage anyways."
"Are we running low? Do we need to kill anything for food," Grunt asked, smiling madly.
"No, Grunt, we'll just get more on the Citadel."
"Oh. Well then, forget I said anything."
Suddenly, the Normandy shook, toppling the boxes, and bringing Miranda and Grunt to the ground.
"What was that," Miranda asked, though mostly to herself. Before she could figure it out, however, she and grunt were lifted into the air.

Backing up, Miranda tripped over herself and fell into Grunt's tank. She was about to jump out, but the case closed, trapping her inside. Miranda banged on the glass, screaming for someone to let her out, but unfortunately, the tank was soundproof. After about ten minutes of screaming, Miranda had given up, accepting that she was, for the time being stuck in Grunt's tank.
She thought about taking a nap, before a rush of water derailed that train of thought. Looking down, the Cerberus Operative saw that water was spilling into the tank, the same that had kept Grunt in stasis. Miranda resumed banging on the glass, screaming until her voice gave out. As the water reached Miranda's neck, she gave up on trying to save herself, resigning herself to either death or stasis. At least she wouldn't have to deal with this crest anymore.

1543111.content:
Miranda doubled over in pain, screaming. The transformation was only beginning and already she felt like Death. Miranda gripped her desk, desperately searching for stability. Suddenly, the Cerberus Operative's hand cramped, twisting into an unnatural shape. Miranda quickly removed her glove, and stared at her contorted hand. As feeling and control slowly came back to it, Miranda was horrified to see a blue pigment spread across her skin.
"Am... Am I becoming an Asari?"
A sharp pain shot up Miranda's back, forcing her to clutch her sides. The pain made its way to Miranda's head. She grabbed onto her scalp, looking to relieve the agony. Her hands clamped around her hair as a sudden jolt of pain struck her. Pulling her hands away, Miranda noticed that she had pulled out a clump of hair in each. Miranda's eyes widened in terror, and she reached once again for her head. As she pulled away more and more hair, Miranda noticed ridges forming on her head. They began to grow out, curving into six, perfectly shaped tentacles. She fell to the ground, screaming, as her skull began to rearrange itself to fit her newfound appearance. Miranda looked down at herself, gasping for air, and saw that the blue pigmentation was creeping up her neck. Miranda knew it was inevitable now, though what she didn't expect was a feeling of... excitement? No, that couldn't be it, she needed to turn back as soon as she could. Miranda rushed to her quarter's window, desperate to see her reflection, she made it to the window in time to see the blue coloration overtake her. Miranda was now fully an Asari. The newly made alien looked down at her body. Now, what to do with it...?
1543111.title: Asari!

Miranda doubled over and nearly choked on the air she so desperately sucked in. The image was unbecoming of the Cerberus officer, doubly so now that she was a stereotypically regal Asari, but it was necessary after the arduous journey to become one. Miranda took one drawn out breath, and quickly stood up straight before she could decide not to. Her vision blurred and blackened. Miranda barely kept herself upright. Her world was figuratively spinning as it was; the disorientation wasnâ€™t helping anything.

The small window of cleavage she displayed; once a useful tool for covert work, and a show of pride; was now quite literally alien. The blue tint of her skin looked strange, as did the scales lining it, but perhaps strangest of all was how similar it felt to her human body. Miranda never considered herself a racist. She was aware of some of Cerberusâ€™ less savory members and missions, but she had never associated herself with either. Still, it was easy to let intrusive thoughts wiggle their way in and fester over time. Miranda poked her right breast, and struggled to contain a moan loud enough for the entire Normandy to hear. Apparently Asari bodies felt different from a humanâ€™s in one very important aspect.

         Miranda knew she needed to see her own face, and she needed privacy. The only place she could get both was in the womenâ€™s bathroom. But that meant a walk of shame there and back. Hell, it meant showing off her new, blue body to the Normandyâ€™s crew. What would Shepard do if he caught her? Miranda knew how much the Commander liked to pretend they controlled this operation. If she was caught performing one of the Illusive Manâ€™s operations behind his back, there would be hell to pay.

         Miranda glanced back at her desk. On her desk, the test tube sat, silently beckoning to her. There was still half a bottle left. An uncharacteristic grin spread wide across Mirandaâ€™s face. If she ran into Shepard, it wouldnâ€™t be a problem. And if she didnâ€™t, then perhaps a trip to Mordin Solusâ€™ office was in order. The Salarian was an inspired scientist; perhaps he could make more of the formula. Sheâ€™d have to ask nicely though. Miranda glanced once again at her blue assets. She laughed. Convincing him wouldnâ€™t be a problem.

154331.content:
Miranda was currently shopping alone on the Citadel while the Normandy was docking for a resupply run. She was tasked with refilling the ship's supply of omni-gel, and Miranda was determined to find the best deal for omni-gel she could find. Obviously, one does not become a savvy operative by always settling for the first option given, so she was shopping around some of the lesser known dealers aboard the space city, hunting for the best value for their allotted credits.

Soon enough, Miranda found herself in one of the seedier marketplaces on the Citadel. A bit run down, but not impossible to find what she needed.

"Over here Earth-clan" a distinctive voice of a Volus directed at Miranda. "I have what you need," the Volus huffed after each sentence.

"How do you know you have what I need, before I haven't even said what it was?" the Cerberus operative asked, unconvinced.

"You're looking for omni-gel, yes? What I have is a very special formula of it. Edible in fact," the Volus pitched.

"Edible? That's not something I'm interested in. What I need to know is, does it work like normal omni-gel?" Miranda inquired.

"But of course Earth-clan! If it didn't, would I be wasting your time right now?" he huffed again.

"I'll humor you, Volus. How much for a one ton shipment of this? Because as you know, there are plenty of other vendors on the Citadel I can get the same amount for 25,000 credits."

"Uhhh, for you Earth-clan, I'm willing to let this omni-gel go for a mere 12,000 credits," the Volus said, almost anxious to be rid of the substance.

"12,000?! Why such a cheap price for a supposedly special formula?" she asked incredulously.

"I'll let you in on an industry secret. The process that makes the omni-gel edible is also the reason it can be produced so cheaply; a few substituted ingredients here and there, and we have this. Don't tell anyone else this trade secret, it could make or break several large, multi-planet corporations before this version of omni-gel goes on the public market." shopkeeper huffed again.

"Well in that case you have a deal." Miranda opened her omni-tool, already prepared to make the credit transfer between accounts.

"I'm glad you made the smart decision Earth-clan," the Volus opened his own omni-tool, accepting the credit transfer and making the shipping arrangements back to the Normandy's docking address. As Miranda turned around, ready to walk back to the ship, the voiced huffed back again. "Earth-clan, don't forgot to take a box of the omni-gel with you, in case you want to sample its edible properties."

Miranda thought to herself why not, and took the small plastic container of the gel and walked off.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------

Once Miranda was twenty feet away, the Volus was left to his own thoughts. "I'm glad that Earth-clan actually bought that lie, I couldn't get rid of that stuff any sooner."

-----------------------------------------------------------------------

Miranda inspected the silver colored container the Volus had handed to her a few minutes earlier. It had omni-gel printed on it, and read edible for both dextro-amino and levo-amino acid lifeforms, supposedly the only substance in the galaxy edible for all known species. She unscrewed the top, inside was the same silver looking slime that all omni-gel looks like. Seemingly nothing special aside from the label on the box about this omni-gel. Honestly, not all that appetizing looking either, but she had been surprised by stranger things in the past.

Miranda debated whether to try the omni-gel herself or give it to someone else, with or without their knowledge.
154331.title: A strange store on the Citadel

choices: Some serious swelling or bloating occurs (inflation or expansion)
1543311.content:
After about a minute of thought, Miranda decided what the heck. It's only a small taste, it probably won't do anything bad to her. She poked one gloved finger into the sludge, picking up some of the slime and brought it her mouth. Hmm, this isn't bad. Miranda thought to herself. Not the absolute best I've ever eaten, but it's pretty darn good for unprepared sludge.

This time she dipped two fingers in, bringing more to waiting gullet. "Mmmmm..." Miranda let out, "better save some for later."

Miranda resealed the lid back on. As soon as she tightened the lid all the way, she felt a queasiness in her stomach.

"Oh damn, what was I thinking? Eating some unknown substance from a random Volus peddler." she placed both of her hands on her now groaning stomach. "How could I be so stupid?"


What happens next to Miranda?
1543311.title: Miranda tries a small sample of the gel

choices: Her belly was bloating to extreme proportions
15433111.content:
"Oooooooohhhhhhhhhhh" Miranda groaned in pain at the same time as her tortured belly. Her crisscrossed arms squeezed her abdomen tightly as the Cerberus operative steeled herself. She was sick from the slime she ate and she wasn't entirely sure what was going to happen next. She wanted to sit down, but at the same time was afraid she might have to puke. And sitting down wouldn't be a good choice if she might have to run any moment from now.

As her stomach churned and stormed, Miranda could feel elsewhere that her outfit was becoming tighter; everywhere. She was swelling or bloating or something, but her outfit was becoming increasingly constricted around her midsection.



How was Miranda swelling?
15433111.title: A swelling sensation

choices: Miranda intercepts the shipment of edible omni-gel
154331111.content:
As quickly as the storm in her stomach began, it subsided, but not without leaving a noticeable mark on Miranda's body. Her belly had a distinctive pouch to it, stretching her shirt and warping some of the hexagon design around her belly. She looked like she had a midterm pregnancy.

Miranda was thankful the discomfort was over, then she picked up the omni-gel container, this time scanning closer for any side-effects or ill health warnings. Nothing was printed on the label, leaving Miranda scrambling to figure out was exactly is happening to her.

"This is all your fault!" she screamed at the inanimate container, squeezing it in her anger. Yet...

At the same time, she desired more of it. Sure the stomach pain was discomforting, but in her brain, she desired more of it, to stuff her face full of the substance.

She immediately removed the container's lid, scarfing down the remaining contents of the grey ooze. She felt immediate disgust with herself for losing control of herself so easily. "Oh god this stuff must have some super addictive chemical in it!" Miranda thought aloud.

She instinctively rubbed her belly, mentally preparing for the coming discomfort. But... the pain never came. Her body must be acclimated to the substance now, because while Miranda didn't feel any discomfort, she did feel a distinct tingly feeling deep in her stomach. A few seconds later and her belly jutted out a few more inches.

Miranda was now torn. She was aware her brain was a slave the addictive chemical within the omni-gel that made her want to consume more of it. She had to decide whether to seek help, or find more of this omni-gel to eat.
154331111.title: The beginnings of addiction

choices: Miranda's bulk gets stuck in the hangar.
1543311111.content:
Help! Help is what I need, Miranda thought to herself. I need medical assistance to fight this addiction! Good, good Miranda, you still have control over yourself. She headed back to the Normandy, to meet with the physician there.

As Miranda got closer to the dock, she saw the shipment of omni-gel, being transported on an automated dolly. Seeing so much of the gel available so easily made Miranda stop in her tracks. She looked at the ship, then back at the omni-gel. Inside her brain, a war was being fought, on one side, Miranda trying to exercise self control, and on the other, the more primitive consumptive side of her. With that much gel nearby, Miranda's consumption won out. She broke into a sprint, rushing for the containers.

These containers were far larger than the small sample jar the Volus gave Miranda earlier; these were large industrial containers meant for transporting vast quantities of omni-gel. Miranda jumped on the first container, opening its contents and pouring it into her eagerly awaiting gullet. She swallowed nearly a hundred gallons of the gel in a matter of minutes. The omni-gel was having some more effects on Miranda's body, fortifying it further to allow for more expansion without hurting her.

Once Miranda finished the first container, saying her stomach was vast would be an understatement. Her belly had grown to be several feet across. Her belly wasn't the only thing growing, Miranda's breasts had joined in the race, having grown through D cups all the way to their current N cups. Miranda's growth was becoming impossible for passerby's to ignore any longer. A veritable crowd was forming around Miranda, coming to see the spectacle of a once thin woman gorging herself to immensity. Despite all of the growth, Miranda's uniform somehow managed to keep covering her, itself expanding and stretching along with its wearer.

Immediately after Miranda finished the first container she started on the second. Tipping over its contents to her mouth, too absorbed in the ecstasy and pleasure the chemical brought to her head to care about the spectacle she had become, Miranda only lived to consume more of the omni-gel. About halfway through the contents of the second container, the true growth effects of the first began to kick in, growing Miranda's stomach by several more feet. By this point, Miranda's belly was so large, it touched the floor while Miranda rested on top of it, bringing ever more gel to her mouth. Her breasts poked further out, now having surpassed any kind of cup measurement, they provided Miranda padding between her chest and transport dolly she leaned over.

Miranda moved on to the third container, her body now growing multiple times larger than the largest elcor on the Citadel. People around her started to panic, worrying how much larger Miranda could possibly reach. Others wanted to take the gel away from her to prevent more growth. Unfortunately, Miranda underwent another growth spurt, her massive belly pushed all bystanders away. None could get close enough to the Cerberus operative to deny her her omni-gel feast. Now Miranda's girth was beginning to press into some of the surrounding ships in the dock, dislodging them out of their locked positions. Her gigantic left breast was now poking into the Normandy, causing it to list slightly over in its parked state.

A siren went off, informing civilians to evacuate the area. All the while Miranda continued to stuff her face, and she was only a quarter of the way finished with the containers.
1543311111.title: Rising girth

15433111111.content:
Once every other person was evacuated from the hangar bay, Miranda was left alone to her own devices. She continued to shovel in more of the gel, oblivious to the rest of her surroundings, not noticing she was easily the largest object in the room.

The Citadel authorities decided the best course of action would be to open the air lock and jettison the bloated woman out to space. The hangar bay doors slowly opened, Miranda only noticing a tug behind her drawing her further away from her feast. She looked behind her, noticing the doors opening up and a strong force behind her. Miranda, in her one track mind, decided to swallow the remaining containers, whole. She grabbed on to the nearest guard railing to her in place long enough to continue eating.

The Cerberus operative lifted one container and brought it to her maw, she opened wider than humanly possible, another effect the omni-gel had on her growing body. It was making her something other than human, maybe something more.

Seeing the other containers get pulled back by airlock, Miranda instead lifted the entire dolly, swallowing everything at once. Upon finishing her feast, Miranda wiped her face with her sleeve, finally content and full. Miranda then let go of the railing, drifting outwards into space.

But instead of the cold, airless void killing her, the omni-gel had changed her body to adapt to all environments, including the inhospitableness of space. Once freely floating in space, Miranda finally came to from her food coma, her mind finally free from the addictive haze the chemical had over her mind. She could actually think about the repercussions her actions put her though, but by now, it was far too late to make a difference. She was scared now of what would happen next to her, for she had no idea what could happen next.

Miranda felt a familiar tingling feeling deep in her stomach. She knew another growth spurt was coming, one far larger than any of the previous. The full contents of the omni-gel reacted with her body, causing the most immense and massive growth to ever occur to any organic being on record. Miranda's hundreds of feet wide belly began expanding further, and further outward. Going from hundreds of feet across to thousands, than to miles across. Miranda was growing and becoming something truly immense.

As her belly grew, so again did her breasts. Each breasts kept pace with her belly, staying around one-fourth the mass and size of the main orb. To the observers on the Citadel, Miranda would have appeared as a single giant sphere if not for her growing mammaries. Impossibly, Miranda's jumpsuit has yet to rupture, expanding miles across along with Miranda. The hexagon design now spread in the miles, each hexagon could house multiple Normandies, then multiple Citadels on them.

Miranda was as shocked as anyone watching at the sheer scale she expanding to. As she expanded larger, the distance between her and the Citadel grew, then shortened. As it turned out, Miranda's mass was growing to such an extent, she was now supporting her own gravitational field, bringing the Citadel close enough to enter an orbit around her.

Her growth reached the thousands of miles, then tens of thousands. She eventually settled at around 50,000 miles across her equator, essentially a little more than twice the size of the Earth. Her breasts were gigantic, literal mountains on her, each breast had a measurement of 15,000 miles high and across. Miranda felt profound embarrassment at becoming such a size, everyone could see how round and bloated she had become. Her moment of weakness had now scarred her reputation permanently. In everyone's eyes, she would always be that woman who ate herself to planetary size, and she looked ridiculous every step of the way.

At least at this size, news cameras had a difficult time finding Miranda's head for reaction shots.

* * *


Sometime later Miranda was declared an official planet, the only one in the newly christened "Miranda System". The system which only included Miranda and the Citadel as her sole satellite that orbited her. Shepard and Cerberus had vowed to find a cure for her; however, progress has been slow since most governments actually took a liking to the new planet, preferring to keep Miranda exactly where she was. Eventually a holiday was made in her honor and talks quickly advanced about the prospects of colonizing her surface.

At the celebration to honor her becoming the new diplomatic center of galactic politics, Subject Zero, better known as Jack, sauntered her way to Miranda's face, ever ready to rub it in at the Cerberus cheerleader's misfortune. Jack made sure to accentuate every thin curve of her normal shaped body, mocking everything Miranda used to have.

"So how's it feel to be a planet, Princess? Bpfff-HAHAHAHAHAH-Ha" the tattooed woman fell laughing to the "floor," in actuality Miranda's bulk. Jack hadn't been able to contain herself since the whole incident had befallen Miranda.

"Jack, shut up."

15511111112.content:
Doctor Chakwas was somber as she placed Samantha's medi-gel body in a tray. She spent several minutes carefully poking her gelatinous form with metal implements, even removing a small part of her which she examined under a microscope. Samantha endured it all in the hope that she would be returned to her body soon.

Finally she gave her diagnosis... though not before pouring herself a very large glass of Serrice Ice Brandy. "There are only two other recorded cases of this happening, but it looks like quantum entanglement. Somehow the mass relay has caused you to fuse with the medi-gel. In a way, you're lucky. In the other instances, the victims both got merged to bulkheads."

Samantha gasped. "Is there any way to get my body back?"

"Of a sort," Chakwas nodded. "But first it's important we get you somewhere safe so you don't dry out or accidentally get used." Taking a large syringe, she inserted into Samantha. She felt herself being drawn up, sucked into the needle until all of her was contained inside, looking out through the plastic walls of the syringe. Chakwas held her in one hand. "You see, your body can be brought back in that your DNA is preserved in the medi-gel. You however will be consumed in the process."

To Samantha's surprise, Chakwas squirted a blob of her body from the syringe onto her fingers. The doctor rubbed her between her hands before massaging the small quantity of medi-gel into her face. When she removed her hands, Samantha gasped. It was her! Chakwas' aged, wrinkled face had become Samantha's; tanned, smooth, with dark brown eyes and youthful lips. Yet her hair and body remained as it had been.

Chakwas examined her reflection in the medibay window, slowly stroking her fingers over the soft new skin of her face, barely remembering her patient held prisoner in the syringe in her hand.

What made his depressed state was what was today, his birthday. Usually, this would excite greatly, but not if no one remembered about it.

He was walking the rebuilt streets of the Citadel when a sight caught his attention. It was a store called Mr. Antiques, what made it special was that it looked like those old stores about 200 years ago around the early 2000s. Shepard has always secretly been fascinated by the past, if he wasn't a soldier, he would of been a history teacher probably. He entered the store and saw a little room full of shelves from the old times. Checking out one of the shelves he picked up a...
15533211.title: A store

155332111.content:
Shepard picked up a decorated box off a shelf and read its name, "Experiencing Changing, 'A Life Changing Experience, Fun With Friends!'" He smiled as he remembered times as a kid when he would play board games with his family. His mom thought it was the best family bonding for him and his sister. Reading the title again, the name seems a little weird for a game. He put down the game and was about to leave when he heard a voice behind him.

"Leaving so soon Commander?" A male voice said behind Shepard.

Shepard turned to see a elderly man in a suit with a confident smile. Something felt off about him, he didn't look weak or anything from old age, it looked like he hasn't had a health problem ever in life. The most unnatural thing was that he radiated a powerful aura.

"Yes sir, I was just looking around." Shepard said politely.

"Are you sure? Something for your birthday perhaps?" The man asked. Shepard tensed before remembering his birthday can easily be searched online.

"I'm sure sir, now, I need to go celebrate today with my friends." Shepard said about to leave.

"Oh please, you know they forgot about your birthday, well that's what you think." The man said waving his hand in a so-what manner.

Shepard stopped halfway out the doors before stopping and turning to the man suspicious.

"How do you know that?" He questioned.

The man shrugged, "Doesn't matter, but I do know about your problem of boredom with your life. I happen to have your solution right here."

Shepard looked at the thing he gestured at, the board game he looked at earlier, "Some role playing game?"

"A game yes, but not any normal game." The man nodded, "It's something past your usual tech."

Shepard raised an eyebrow and became weary, "Better than our tech, say something like, Reapers?"

The man waved it off, "Oh please, those kids? No something even before them."

"What do you mean?" Shepard asked.

"Forget it, just take it." The man said giving him the game, "The rules and everything is inside. I promise it will be fun."

Shepard looked down at the game, "Okay...how much is i-" until he stopped when he looked up to see the man was gone. He walked out of the store and turned around to take a look of the store again to find it missing, just an empty alleyway. Game in hand, Shepard pondered where to go.
155332111.title: Board Game

1553321111.content:
Deciding where to go, Shepard headed over to where the repaired Normandy SR-2 was docked. If he wasn't able to celebrate his birthday today doesn't mean he couldn't have a good time. After some walking, he entered the airlock and into the ship where he got a big surprise.

"HAPPY BIRTHDAY!" His crew shouted out as he entered. Shepard looked around in surprise at the surprised birthday party his friends set up for him. Everybody was wearing party hats with some aliens confused as to what they are. Food was set up where Jack and Zaeed were already drinking and Grunt with his off center party hat was smothering himself in the cake.
